Both the variants feature a whopping 6GB of RAM.

The company also claims the device to be the world’s first metal unibody phone with invisible antenna lines.

Coming to the camera specs, the device flaunts a 23-megapixel rear camera with OIS as well as EIS and also capable of recording videos up to 4K. Up front, it features an 8-megapixel snapper with wide angle lens. The ZenFone 3 Deluxe packs in a 3000mAh battery coupled with Qualcomm Quick Charge 3.0 technology.

It has a proximity sensor, accelerometer, ambient light sensor and gyroscope. It also has a Funtouch OS 2.6 which is a unique feature giving a smooth and fluid experience with customization of its OS.
Camera and Storage:: It is equipped with a 16MP rear camera and a flash. It has an 8MP front camera that allows users to click selfies. This dual SIM smartphone has a vast internal storage capacity of 128GB, is not expandable and has a 6GB RAM.
Battery and Connectivity:: The Vivo Xplay5 Elite has a removable 3600mAh battery. It offers Wi-Fi connectivity, with 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac and GPS navigation. Both SIMs support 4G services of band 40 in India.

Overview: The Vivo Xplay 6 will likely be the flagship offering and the internals are definitely top spec. It features a Quad HD resolution screen and is powered by the Snapdragon 821 processor which is also powering the Pixel smartphones. The same chip is expected to power the upcoming OnePlus 3T as well.

The Xplay 6 also sports 6GB of RAM on board and gets 128GB of internal storage as standard. Like other Vivo smartphones, the phone will run the company’s Funtouch OS on top of Android. The phone also packs in a 4000mAh battery. The phone is set to sport a dual camera setup. Notably, the X9 and the X9 Plus launching alongside have a dual front facing camera setup. The X9 Plus also has a similar setup on the back. These phones are powered by Snapdragon 653 processors and have 6GB of RAM onboard.
While Vivo has never launched the Xplay series in India, it’ll be interesting to see if things change this time around. Read latest news and information about upcoming smartphones at Pricebaba Daily.

OnePlus has launched it’s next level flagship phone the OnePlus 6. The phone comes with improvements in certain areas as compared to its predecessor. Let’s find out what this new device offers out of the box:
Display & Design:

Beginning with the display the OnePlus 6 rocks a large 6.28-inch AMOLED  bezel-less display. It bears a Full HD+ resolution of 2280 x 1080 pixels which translates to a 402PPI pixel density producing a sharp and crisp display. Design-wise, the OnePlus 6 looks different than all of its previous versions. This is due to the notch located on the top of display. The phone rocks an all glass body. A Corning Gorilla Glass is fitted on the top of the screen as well as the back to ensure protection against accidental damage & scratches. There is a USB Type-C connector for charging and transferring data. The phone retains a 3.5 mm headphone jack for connecting any audio accessories. On the flip side, the dual rear cameras are now vertically aligned along with the fingerprint sensor mounted below. Both are located in the middle.
Camera:

In the photography department, the OnePlus 6 is not much different than the previous OnePlus 5T. It sports a dual rear camera comprising of a 16MP primary sensor assisted by a 20MP secondary sensor. It has an aperture of f/1.7 and is accompanied by a dual LED flash for better pictures in low light. The primary rear camera now offers Optical Image Stabilisation (OIS) along with Electronic Image Stabilisation (EIS). Upfront, there is a 16MP snapper with f/2.0 aperture for clicking selfies. The rear camera is capable of recording 4k videos.
Performance, Storage & OS:

On the performance front, the OnePlus 6 stays up to its tagline ‘The speed you need’. Under the hood, it houses a 2.8GHz Qualcomm’s flagship Snapdragon 845 octa-core chipset. It is coupled with 8GB RAM and and Adreno 630 graphics processor onboard. The aforementioned hardware ensures seamless multitasking and lag-free gaming performance. As for storage, this device offers 128GB internal memory. It can’t be expanded as it lacks a microSD card slot. Like all the OnePlus phones, this one runs on custom Oxygen OS as well, it is layered on the top of Android 8.0 Oreo OS. OnePlus has added a feature where you can hide the notch if you don’t like it.
Battery & Connectivity:

The OnePlus 6 is powered by a 3300 mAh non-removable battery which is the same as seen on OnePlus 5T. There is support for fast charging on the phone. It functions as a dual SIM smartphone and supports Nano SIM cards. For networking, all the basic connectivity options like 4G LTE, 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth, NFC and VoLTE are included.

Pros: Dash charge ensures very fast charging
Cons: Dual Camera setup could have been better

Xiaomi, the Chinese smartphone maker, launched the Mi Note 3. The Mi Note 3 is situated above the recently launched Mi A1(Mi 5X) and below the flagship for 2017, the Mi 6. As the unique selling points to this device, Xiaomi has touted its newly developed AI-based Beautify feature and facial recognition unlocking.

Design
On the design front, the Mi Note 3 features an ergonomic design owing to its 4-sided curved body that is made out of glass. The glass back is inscribed by 7-Series aluminium alloy. Up front, Xiaomi has integrated a fingerprint sensor on the front which also doubles up as a home button.

Display and Camera
The phone boasts of a 5.5-inch Full HD display that has a resolution of 1920 x 1080 pixels. The display features an IPS LCD panel and bears a pixel density of 403 PPI. For the shutterbugs, the Xiaomi Mi Note 3, packs in a dual camera setup at the rear comprising of a 12-megapixel sensor which is a wide-angle lens having an aperture of f/1.8 and 4-axis optical image stabilisation and a secondary 12-megapixel sensor which is a telephoto lens having an aperture of f/2.6. On the front, the phone features a 16-megapixel selfie camera that is equipped with the AI-based beauty feature. The front-facing camera is also capable of unlocking the phone thanks to improved facial recognition.

Performance, Battery, and Storage
In terms of performance, the Mi Note 3 is powered by a Snapdragon 660 SoC clocked at 2.2GHz. This processor configuration is coupled with 6 GB of RAM on all storage variations of the device. As far as internal memory is concerned, the Mi Note 3 will ship in two variants – 64GB and 128GB, however, the internal memory of this device cannot be expanded through a microSD card. To keep the smartphone up and running, the offering from Xiaomi also boasts of a hefty 3500mAh battery unit that should get you through your day with moderate use.

Connectivity
On the connectivity front, Xiaomi has included multiple 4G LTE bands so that the device doesn’t miss out on LTE connectivity, no matter the carrier you use. It also supports dual-band Wi-Fi 802.11c alongside Bluetooth v5.0 and a USB Type-C port located on the bottom. Unfortunately, the 3.5mm headphone jack has been dropped on this offering from Xiaomi.
SImilar smartphones worth checking out:
1. Xiaomi Mi A1
2. Motorola Moto G5s Plus

The Blackberry KEYone is the first smartphone to be unveiled ahead of the MWC event at Barcelona. It isn’t a surprise since it was displayed to the masses under its codename ‘Mercury’ at CES earlier this year. While we think that Mercury would’ve been a much cooler name to go with, the KEYone is definitely unique.

The BlackBerry KEYone is yet another phone made by TCL with the design and software controlled by the Canadian company. The aluminium unibody design is stunning to look at and what makes the phone unique is the QWERTY keypad that sits below the display. It has a 4.5-inch display in a 3:2 aspect ratio that is protected by Corning Gorilla Glass 4. The screen resolution is a little odd at 1620 x 1080 pixels.

While we have seen the smartphone in multiple leaks earlier, the hardware underneath was a complete mystery. The BlackBerry KEYone is powered by a Snapdragon 625 octa-core processor (one of the most efficient processors in recent times) and has 3GB of RAM. BlackBerry has coupled that with a 3505mAh battery which they claim make it a two-day phone. It uses a USB Type-C port for charging and with QuickCharge 3.0 it can top up to 50% juice in 36 minutes.

The BlackBerry KEYone sports a 12-megapixel Sony camera on the back with a pixel size of 1.55 microns. It gets phase detection autofocus along with electronic image stabilisation and a dual tone LED flash. The camera is capable of recording 4K video at 30 FPS. At the front, the KEYone has an 8-megapixel selfie shooter with screen flash. It has an 84-degree field of view, gets image and video stabilisation and is capable of recording 1080p video.

The software on the phone is up to date as it runs on Android 7.1 Nougat with a suite of BB apps. Blackberry Messenger, Blackberry Hub, and the DTEK security app come pre-loaded with this phone. In terms of storage, the phone has 32GB of onboard storage it is further expandable via microSD cards up to 2TB. One of the unique design approaches on the phone is the fingerprint scanner on the front that is discreetly hidden under the spacebar.

Coming to the front, the device features a powerful 44MP wide-angle selfie shooter. The camera arrives with features likeAuto Flash, Auto Focus, Bokeh Effect, Continuos Shooting, Exposure compensation, Face detection, Geo tagging, High Dynamic Range mode (HDR), ISO control, Touch to focus, White balance presets.

Overview: South Korean electronics giant LG has launched the LG V30 Plus that has all the features every user wants. Let’s take a detailed look at the device’s overview:
Display & Design:

The LG V30+ boasts of a QHD+ OLED display with a 2880 x 1440 pixel resolution which yields a pixel density of 537 PPI. A Corning Gorilla Glass 5 is fitted on top of the screen for protection against accidental damage & scratches. Like most bezel less smartphones, there are no physical buttons on the front & the fingerprint scanner has been mounted on the back of the device. Design-wise, the V30+ sports a metallic body which feels sturdy, while the glass back prevents the phone from slipping from your hands. There is a USB Type-C connector along with a 3.5mm headphone jack. The V30+ is IP68-certified dust & water resistant. Sensors on the phone include accelerometer, proximity sensor, barometer, & gyroscope. It ships in two attractive colors ie. Black & Silver.
Camera:

In the photography department, the V30+ is equipped with a dual rear camera system. It comprises of a primary 16MP camera with f/1.6 aperture lens for better low light photography. There is a secondary 13MP shooter with 120 degree wide angle lens & an f/1.9 aperture lens. The dual cameras are accompanied by an LED flash. There is also PDAF system that aids in quick focusing. Upfront there is a 5MP snapper for clicking selfies. The rear camera offers 4k video recording (2160p).
Performance, Storage & OS:

Under the hood, the V30+ houses a powerful & power efficient Qualcomm Snapdragon 835 octa-core processor seen in most flagship smartphones today. It packs 4GB RAM along with Adreno 540 graphics processor onboard. The device offers massive 128GB internal storage which can be expanded up to 2TB via microSD card. It runs on Android 7.1 Nougat out of the box and might get an update to Android 8.0 Oreo soon.
Battery & Connectivity:

The LG V30+ is powered by a 3300 mAh non-removable battery. The phone supports wireless charging & features Qualcomm’s Quick Charge 3.0 technology. It functions as a dual sim smartphone with support for nano sim cards. Connectivity options on the phone include GPS, 4G LTE, 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth, NFC & VoLTE.
Frequently Asked Questions About LG V30+:
1. Will this phone work with Reliance Jio network?
Ans: Yes, you can use Reliance Jio on this phone as it supports VoLTE connectivity.
2. How is the camera for selfies?
Ans: The device features a 5MP front camera which captures good quality selfies.
3. What type of charging connector do I need?
Ans: The V30+ supports latest USB Type-C connectorfor charging & data syncing.
4.What comes in the box?
Ans: With LG V30+ you will get charger & a separate cable, earphone, sim ejector tool & a user manual.

This phone weighs around 183.5 grams. It is available in Gold and Rose Gold color variants. Its size dimensions are 158.9 x 78 x 7.5 mm.

Internal storage of 64GB and cannot be extended and comes with inbuilt sensors like fingerprint sensor, gyroscope, proximity, ambient light, and accelerometer.
Camera & Storage:: The Vivo X7 Plus offers a primary camera of 16MP with f/2.0, phase detection autofocus, and LED flash on the rear side. The front camera of the phone provides 16MP at f/2.0 with LED flash.
Battery & Connectivity:: The Vivo X7 Plus has a 4000mAh Li-Ion non-removable battery and offers dual SIM facility in which both are Nano-SIM and support 3G/4G and comes with Bluetooth 4.0, Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n, FM, and USB support are present.

Overview: Poco has now officially launched the Poco F1 Armoured Edition 128GB which turns out to be a budget smartphone that tries to deliver the absolute bang for the buck. The Poco F1 Armoured Edition 128GB has a large 4000mAh battery and a Qualcomm Snapdragon 845 chipset. The device also scores well in the display and cameras department.
Design and Display: The Poco F1 Armoured Edition 128GB features a 6.18 inch IPS LCD display with a resolution of 1080 x 2246 pixels and a pixel density of 403ppi. Battery and Performance: The Poco F1 Armoured Edition 128GB is embedded with the Qualcomm Snapdragon 845 chip and a Adreno 630 GPU. The RAM and internal storage of the device stand at 6GB and 128GB respectively. The device also supports memory cards up to 256GB. Battery life with this device is not going to be an issue with the large 4000mAh Li-Polymer battery that it comes with.

Overview: With its highly competitive pricing, Xiaomi has already conquered the online smartphone market in India. Now, the company is eyeing the offline market. Even though online players offer huge discounts and products with more value for money, it still comprises of only 30-35% of market share. The offline channels still rule the smartphone market in India by a great margin.

Xiaomi knows it very well, that’s why it’s trying very hard to make its offline presence also. The recent moves such as Launching retail stores, coming up with offline-only products like Redmi 3S Plus completely justifies the earlier statement. Well, now as per the latest reports, Xiaomi is planning to come up with a smartphone lineup under a new sub-brand aimed at the offline market.

Currently, the offline market in India is being ruled by the likes of Oppo, Vivo and Gionee. With their robust distribution and marketing techniques, these companies have already grown deep roots into the offline segment. Xiaomi is also planning to do the same, but not with its current lineup. The company is planning to come up with a new lineup which will be called Lanmi.

The Lanmi X1 is speculated to be the first smartphone to launch under this sub-brand. Talking about the specs, the device is expected to sport a  5.5-inch Full HD display with a resolution of 2160 x 1080 pixels. Under the hood, it will be powered by Qualcomm’s Snapdragon 660 chipset. As per the reports, the phone is supposed to come in two different variants. The top variant will get a virtually bezel-less display, 6GB of RAM and multiple storage options among 64GB and 128GB. The other variant comes with the regular display, 4GB of RAM and the same storage options of 64GB and 128GB.

The Lanmi X1 is also said to sport a dual rear camera setup. There are also rumours floating around claiming the phone to sport a front dual camera setup too. Apart from that, the device will also feature a rear-mounted fingerprint scanner. And, the handset is supposed to get a metal unibody design with a rear-mounted fingerprint scanner.
As per the reports, Xiaomi is planning to launch the Lanmi X1 at the end of this month i.e., July. The remaining specs and complete design of the device will only be confirmed by then.

Overview: Oppo launched its latest selfie-focused smartphone dubbed the Oppo A77. It boasts of a 16-megapixel front-facing camera for selfies, which is also a selling point for the brand. It comes in two colours: Gold and Rose Gold.

The Oppo A77 runs Android 6.0 Marshmallow-based Color OS 3.0, which is a bummer. The phone also lacks a dedicated memory card support. It comes with a hybrid SIM slot wherein the second slot can be used to expand the storage up to 128GB.
Up front, there is a 5.5-inch 1080p display. Inside, there is a 1.5GHz MediaTek MT6750T octa-core processor, 4GB of RAM, and 64GB of storage.
As far as cameras are concerned, the Oppo A77 houses a 13-megapixel primary sensor with PDAF, f/2.2 aperture, and dual LED flash.
Oppo claims that the portrait mode inside the device can produce a depth-of-field effect using a background blur feature. It also comes with a front-mounted fingerprint scanner.
The Oppo A7 packs a 3,200mAh battery in addition to the set of connectivity options such as 4G LTE, Wi-Fi, GPS and more.

Overview: Introduction:

The Galaxy J7+ is the company latest offering as a mid-range budget smartphone with top-notch specs. Successor to the Galaxy J7 and the Galaxy J7 Pro, the J7+ gets an all-metal unibody design with a well-built body.
Display & Hardware:

Talking about specs, the Galaxy J7+ puts on a 5.5-inch Full HD Super AMOLED display with a resolution of 1920 x 1080 pixels. Under the hood, the phone is powered by an octa-core MediaTek Helio P20 processor ticking at 2.4GHz. Accompanying the chipset, the handset gets 4GB of RAM and 32GB of internal storage further expandable up to 256GB via MicroSD card.
Operating System & Camera:

The Galaxy J7+ runs Android Nougat out-of-the-box and is expected to get the Android Oreo sometime next year. The phone also gets the Samsung's own AI assistant known as Bixby. Talking about photography, the device sports a dual rear camera setup comprising a 13-megapixel standard lens and a 5-megapixel monochrome lens. The main sensor has an aperture size of f/1.9, thus capable of capturing more light and providing crisp image-output, especially in low-light conditions. Up front, the handset flaunts a 16-megapixel shooter for selfies and video calling.
Battery & Connectivity:

It's a Dual SIM phone and also supports 4G LTE connectivity. Talking about connectivity options, the phone includes Wi-FI, Bluetooth, VoLTE, and 3.5mm audio jack. The phone also sports a front-mounted fingerprint scanner integrated into the home button. Powering all, the phone packs in a 3,600mAh battery.

Pros: Full sized QWERTY keyboard is fantastic to type on
Solid build quality that inspires confidence
Compact size of the device means you can easily use the phone with one hand

Overview: A subsidy brand of ZTE, Nubia is in the Indian market since quite sometime now. Even though the sales of the brand are not that promising, the brand still has managed to survive in this cut throat competition. Nubia has been selling its devices in an exclusive partnership with Amazon India, whereas ZTE branded phones are exclusive to Flipkart.

The phone has a metal unibody construction but is quite thick at 8.9mm. The design looks & feels solid but the extra thickness might be a bummer. On the front lies a 5.5-inch FHD display with a pixel density of 401PPI & is protected by Corning Gorilla Glass 3.

MediaTek's Helio P10 MT6755 Octa Core processor is the one used in this device & is paired with 3GB of RAM which delivers decent overall performance. On the software front, it runs on Android 6.0 Marshmallow out of the box. Besides, it has a fingerprint sensor for additional protection on the rear of the device.

Both rear & front of the device sport a 13MP camera that can shoot videos up to 1080p & should capture good shots as well. And to store all the date you get 64GB internal storage that can further be expanded up to 256GB via a MicroSD card.

The massive 5000mAh battery of the Nubia N1 is a huge plus & should easily last you for more than a day. Sadly, it does not support fast or wireless charging. It is a Dual SIM device if you do not wish to use a MicroSD card (hybrid second slot) & support all major networks in India. Yes, Reliance Jio is also supported, thanks to the VoLTE feature.

Introduction:: Samsung Galaxy C5 Pro will be expected to be launched in May 2017. Like any other Samsung Smartphones, Samsung Galaxy C5 Pro also a powerful Smartphone with loads of features. text.Display and Design: The Samsung Galaxy C5 is one of the very first devices in the 'C Series' of smartphones from Samsung. The series is primarily focused at coming up with smartphones with metallic body and no compromise specifications. Alongside the Galaxy C5, the Galaxy C7 is the other device in the C Series that we have already seen.
text.Hardware and Features: First look at the Samsung Galaxy C5 and you would be excused for mistaking it for the iPhone 6. In fact, the device also features the dreaded and much criticised rubber antennae lines that run on the back. As for the display, just like every high-end Android phone from Samsung, the display is drop dead gorgeous. You get a 5.2 inch screen with a Full HD resolution, giving the screen a pixel density of 424. Add to the fact that the display is Super AMOLED, the colours really pop out of the display.
text.Camera and Storage: Powering the Samsung Galaxy C5 is an Octa Core Snapdragon 617 chipset with Adreno 405 GPU. There is 4GB of RAM to keep your experience stutter free. You also have a fingerprint scanner on the home button. As for the internal storage, you have an option of picking either a 32GB or a 64GB variant. It should not prove to be too difficult a decision as the phone features a Hybrid SIM slot, which can double up as a slot for the MicroSD card. As with every Android phone made by Samsung, there is a custom TouchWiz UI on top. Below it is the latest Android 6.0.1 Marshmallow.
text.Battery and Connectivity: The rear camera on the Samsung Galaxy C5 features a 16 MP sensor. There is a dual tone LED flash on the rear to assist you with shooting when there is not sufficient light. The rear camera is capable of recording 1080p videos at 30fps. The front facing camera is an 8MP shooter. As mentioned above, the internal storage is either 32GB or 64GB depending on your choice, though you do get a slot to expand that storage using a MicroSD card of up to 128GB.
text.Competition: The Galaxy C5 features a non-removable 2600mAh Li-Ion battery. The battery should last you for a working day on moderate usage. Just like most modern day phones, the Samsung Galaxy C5 comes with a vast array of connectivity options. You have the likes of WiFi, Bluetooth, LTE, GPS, NFC all on board. This device has a hybrid SIM slot, so you can easily have two micro SIM cards in there with dual standby. You also get fest battery charging which promises to charge up to 83% of your phone in just 30 minutes.

Pros: Well built body with just 6.7mm thickness

Overview: Xperia T3 is Sonys newest phablet in the market and based on the name it sounds like the successor to the Xperia T2 (but it isnt). Sony has adopted the OmniBalance design philosophy for most of its devices and the Xperia T3 is no exception. The phablets have recently shown a lot of promise in the developing markets and Sony is aiming to capitalize on the situation. Sony took the formula applied to the Xperia T2 and after a bit of changes, enter the Xperia T3.

The Xperia T3 has a lot of similarities when compared to the Xperia T2. The same 1.4 GHz Cortex A7 Quad Core processors along with 1GB of RAM are in charge of the processing. The screen resolution remains the same (at 1280 x 720 pixels) along with the Triluminos display and the Mobile BRAVIA Engine 2. But the Xperia T3 is much smaller at 5.3 inches, thereby making the display sharper; and the dimensions much more handy. The device comes with the same 8GB of internal storage with MicroSD slot for expansion. The camera has been reduced to 8 megapixel sensor as compared to the 13 megapixel on the Xperia T2 with no changes to the front facing camera.

The Xperia T3 comes with Android Kitkat (4.4.2) out of the box with Sony's Customizations. Sony claims it to be the slimmest 5.3 device, packing in a huge screen and components in a slim unibody construction. The battery at 2500 mAh seems like a bit of a compromise to reduce the thickness of the device, but we're guessing should be OK considering the mid-range specs of the device.
1. Does it support OTG?: Ans: No, it doesn’t support OTG.
2. Does the phone have a Hybrid SIM slot: Ans: No, it has a dedicated slot for MicroSD card up to 32GB.
Ans: No, the Sony Xperia T3 comes with a 2500mAh non-removable battery.
4. Does it work with Reliance Jio Network?
Ans: No, it doesn’t works with Reliance Jio Network.
5. What is the thickness of this phone?: Ans: Sony Xperia T3 is very slim device with only 5.3mm thickness and has a unibody construction.

text.Display & Design: HTC has a bit of a rough ride, where some have blamed its poor marketing skills while the others have taken up the issue of poor pricing. Despite making real premium smartphones, the brand has lost out to the likes of Apple and Samsung who seem to always bring a better package than HTC. This has resulted in HTC launching tons and tons of devices in the hope that they stumble upon the winning formula.
text.Hardware and Features: The HTC Desire 630 is a mid range phone that HTC announced at MWC 2016, in order to make serious inroads in the budget segment. However, the phone had a delayed launch in India, which kind of killed the buzz.
text.Camera & Storage: HTC has gone with a 5 inch HD Super LCD panel on the Desire 630. This roughly equates to about 294PPI. Compare this to devices like Le 2 or even the Motorola Moto G4 Plus which bring a Full HD display in the same sort of price range, and you can see where HTC has cut the corners. Like most of the mid range phones especially in the Desire series, the 630 comes with a plastic body. There is no metal goodness going on here. The phone has an interesting painted home button in bright orange colour, which adds a bit of a personality to otherwise a bland candybar design. The phone has stereo speakers on the front, which is good to see.
text.Battery and Connectivity: Powering the HTC Desire 630 is a Snapdragon 400 chipset. There is 2GB of RAM on board. There is a serious lack of firepower there on the phone especially when you consider the likes of Zuk Z1 come which come with Snapdragon 801 in lesser. The good part about the phone is the BoomSound speakers on the front, which gives the device excellent media playback capability. Overview: Samsung Galaxy A30s 128GB is a mid-range smartphone by Samsung, which brings some amazing features. It has ample battery capacity with fast charging support so the users can charge the device on-the-go. Apart from that, it has an excellent display quality, massive internal storage, amazing camera set up and many more reasons to choose this as your next smartphone.
Display and Camera: Samsung Galaxy A30s 128GB flaunts a 6.4-inch Super AMOLED display. The screen bears a resolution of 720 x 1560 pixels along with a pixel density of 268PPI. The smartphone features an admirable display design but it lacks screen protection, which is disappointing.

For the camera, the device depends on a triple primary lens set-up that consists of a 25MP, 8MP and 5MP sensors. At the front, it has a 16MP lens which allows the users to capture bright and crisp selfies.
Configuration and Battery: Samsung Galaxy A30s 128GB is seated on a Samsung Exynos 7 Octa 7904 chipset. It is powered by a dual-core 1.8GHz Cortex A73 and a hexa-core 1.6GHz Cortex A53 processor. To handle the graphics of the device, it is coupled with a Mali-G71 MP2 GPU. There is a 4GB RAM to keep the games and apps running smoothly.
The device derives power from a Li-ion battery with 4,000mAh capacity that is coupled with fast charging support.
Storage and Connectivity: To store the files and data of the users, the smartphone has an internal memory capacity of 128GB that can be expanded up to 512GB with the expense of a microSD card.

For connectivity, the Samsung Galaxy A30s 128GB supports 4G VoLTE, USB Type-C, Bluetooth 5.0, A-GPS, Wi-Fi, Mobile Hotspot, NFC, and many more. Other features include a Light sensor, Proximity sensor, Accelerometer and Gyroscope. Further, this device has an on-screen fingerprint scanner.

Overview: Xiaomi's Redmi 2 and the Redmi 2 Plus has been a huge hit in the Indian market and one of the major reason it being this hit is Xiaomi's pricing strategy. The features and specs then offered with the two phones were an absolute value for money for the price it was offered at. Following the similar trend, Xiaomi this year is back with the two devices Xiaomi Redmi 3s and the Xiaomi Redmi 3s Plus. Again these phones offer great value for money and have a price difference of Rs. 2000, however the extra amount is totally worth it as the expensive Redmi 3s Plus features a fingerprint scanner and an extra GB of RAM.

Even the display size of the device is rarely found these days at 5 inch, it is great for one hand usage. The resolution of the display is 1280x720 pixels (HD) which gives it a pixel density of 294PPI which does sound sharp enough and on the display we do not get any sort of protection. The phone looks good and well build to not make any creaking sound and has a similar design to the Xiaomi Redmi Note 3.

Inside Xiaomi Redmi 3s Plus runs on a Qualcomm Snapdragon 430 Octa Core chipset that is clocked at 1.4Ghz and paired along is 3GB of RAM. The device should perform well, thanks to the decent processor and ample 2GB of RAM for an decent multitasking experience. The phone also features an IR blaster which acts as a remote to most of the home appliances and a fingerprint scanner on the rear of the device which is fast and quite accurate while unlocking the device.

The Redmi 3s Plus has got a 13MP sensor on the rear that is capable of recording Full HD (1080p) videos whereas on the front lies a 5MP shooter. The rear sensor also features Phase Detection Autofocus (PDAF) and there is also an LED Flash to help take pictures in light conditions. The battery of the device is yet another excellent feature to have but the charging time is quite more despite being said to have fast charging. Thanks to the massive 4100mah battery unit sealed inside the device, the Redmi 3s Plus delivers impressive battery backup.

Xiaomi Redmi 3s Plus is a 4G LTE enabled device and also supports VoLTE. Even though it is a Dual SIM device only the first SIM supports VoLTE and the second slot is Hybrid, meaning it will either accept the second SIM or you can use the slot expand storage on the phone to up to 128GB via a MicroSD card.

India as a market has been very receptive towards devices that serve the purpose, both of a smartphone and a tablet. Therefore, it should come as no surprise that most manufacturers today include a phablet in their catalogue. When it comes to iBall, a smartphone manufacturer from India, the Cobalt 6 sits in there as their offering for the users who are interested in phablet devices.
Display & Design: The Cobalt 6 comes with a 6 inch Full HD display, which gives the phone a pixel density of 367 PPI, which should make for a nice reading as well as multimedia consumption experience. The design of the phone is largely plastic, though you do have a soft touch feel on the back. Other than that, the design is rather uninspiring and you have the candybar form factor on the iBall Cobalt 6. The chassis on the phone sees the overall thickness to be around 8.9mm.
Hardware and Features: Powering the Cobalt 6 is an Octa-core 1.7GHz chipset with A7 cores. There is 2GB of RAM, which should deliver you enough power and memory to be able to do most of the everyday tasks without much hiccup. One positive thing for the phone is that it comes with read and write support for 15 regional languages in India. On the software side of the story, you get slightly dated Android 4.4 Kitkat.
Camera & Storage: The rear camera on the Cobalt 6 is a 16MP sensor with BSI sensor and a Dual LED flash on the back. This LED flash can not just help you out when taking shots in dim light, but also can double up as a torch using any supported torch application. The front facing camera is an 8MP sensor with Auto Focus, that should suffice for your needs for clicking selfies and video calling.
Battery and Connectivity: iBall Cobalt 6 ships with 3000mAh battery out of the box. While, this may not be enough for the phone to be counted among the big battery phones, this should get you through a day on light usage. However, anything beyond that and you can expect the phone to look for its charger before it is time to go to bed. There is no LTE here, though you do have 3G support on both the SIM cards that the phone can use. The SIM slots here utilise Full sized SIM cards instead of micro or nano SIM. There is WiFi connectivity alongside Bluetooth here. There is also USB OTG support.
Competition: In the Rs 8,000 range, the phones that really could give the iBall Cobalt 6 run for its money are the Coolpad Note 3 and the Lenovo Vibe K5 Plus. If you can raise your budget a little, which we would recommend you to, devices like the Redmi Note 3 and the LeEco Le 1s would be excellent choices.

Along with the launch of the much awaited Redmi 5, Xiaomi has also launched Redmi 5 Plus. The Redmi 5 Plus is the elder sibling of Redmi 5 with some key differences. Let’s take a look at the device overview:
Display & Design:

The Redmi 5 Plus sports a 5.9-inch FHD+ display with a resolution of 2160 x 1080 pixels. It features an 18:9 aspect ratio screen with pixel density of 403 PPI. For protection against accidental damage & scratches, Xiaomi has fitted a Corning Gorilla Glass on the top. Due to the bezel-less screen, there are no physical buttons on the front. A fingerprint sensor is located on the backside of device. The device sports a metallic unibody & has rounded corners. On the top there is a 3.5 mm headphone jack. The phone has various sensors like accelerometer, proximity, magnetometer & ambient light sensor. This device ships in five attractive colors i.e. Light Blue, Rose Gold, Gold & Black.
Camera:

On the camera front, the Redmi 5 comes with a 12MP rear camera sensor accompanied by dual tone LED flash. It features a PDAF system. On the front, there is a 5MP snapper with soft-light selfie flash module for better selfies in low light environment. Camera features include geo-tagging, touch focus, HDR & beautify 3.0. The rear camera is capable of recording full HD videos.
Performance, Storage & OS:

In terms of hardware, the Redmi 5 is powered by an octa-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 625 processor ticking at 2GHz. It packs 3GB RAM along with Adreno 506 graphics processor onboard. Performance-wise, the device functions smoothly without any lags & hassles. It offers 32GB internal storage which can be upgraded up to 128GB via microSD card. The Redmi 5 runs on Android 7.1 Nougat  out of the box with MIUI 9 skinned on the top.
Battery & Connectivity:

The Redmi 5 packs a 4000 mAh non-removable battery. It offers fast charging feature. The device offers dual sim functionality & supports nano sim cards. Connectivity options on this phone include GPS, FM Radio, 4G LTE, 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth & VoLTE support.

Ans: Yes, Reliance Jio is compatible with this phone due to VoLTE connectivity.

In order to cater to its selfie-loving gen-X audience, Asus launched the ZenFone Live. As the name suggests, the main attraction of the device is what the company calls as  the “world’s first live streaming beautification technology.”

Display and Design
The phone features a  plastic overall build and a compact but sturdy body. The device weighs in at just 120 grams which makes it super lightweight and easy to grip. On the front, the phone sports a 5-inch HD IPS LCD display with a 2.5D curved glass on top to enhance the user experience.

Camera
The camera, moreover the software that drives the camera on this device is the unique selling point of this device. The smartphone rocks a13-megapixel rear-facing camera with some neat software tricks like image beautification under its sleeves. On the front, the phone features a 5-megapixel selfie camera which is also backed up with software features like Beautify Live that offer image beautifying in a video whilst also streaming on your favourite social media website.

Performance and Storage
Underneath the fun and frolic that the camera and its software have to offer, the smartphone is powered by a quad-core Snapdragon processor coupled with 2GB of RAM for a seamless user interface. The phone also comes bundled with an Adreno 305 GPU to make the user experience feel lag-free. In terms of storage, the offering from Asus ships with 16GB of internal storage which can be expanded with the aid of a microSD card up to 128GB.

Battery and Connectivity
The Asus Zenfone Live draws its power from a 2650mAh non-removable Li-ion battery pack located underneath its hood. As for connectivity, the phone offers all the conventional solutions like Bluetooth, WiFi, 4G VoLTE, GPS and a micro USB port for interfacing and charging purposes. The device runs ASUS custom interface - ZenUI 3 built over Android 6.0 Marshmallow.

The A5000 sits comfortably in the palm of your hand with its ergonomic and rounded shape body. Also thanks to its splash-proof nano-coating which prevent its screen from rain or a spilled drink. Realme's upcoming mid-ranger dubbed Realme C25s might actually be one of the cheapest devices of all time. This device also has the potential to be crowned as the next mid-range killer. Not just that but the smartphone will also pack in a great value for money and some amazing specs for the price such as a huge 6000mAh battery, a great camera setup, and a lot more. The smartphone will be powered by the MediaTek Helio G85 Octa core SoC.
Design and Display: The Realme C25s will reportedly boast a 6.5 inch IPS LCDdisplay with a resolution of 720 x 1600 pixelsand a high pixel density of 270ppi to fabricate rich and crisp visuals. The bezel-less display will supposedly sport an immersive Waterdrop notch design along with an aspect ratio of 20:9 for enhanced viewing experience. The device will come with a screen to body ratio of 88.7% and a refresh rate of 60Hz.
Cameras: The Realme C25s is expected to house a triple rear camera with a 13MP primary sensor, a 2MP macro sensor, and a 2MP sensor with LED flash support onboard. Coming to the front, the device will feature a 8MP selfie shooter. The camera will arrive with features likeAF Phase Detection, Artificial Intelligence, Auto Flash, Auto Focus, Bokeh Effect, Continuos Shooting, Exposure compensation, Face detection, Geo tagging, High Dynamic Range mode (HDR), ISO control, Time Lapse, Touch to focus, White balance presets.
Battery and Performance: The Realme C25s will be baked with the MediaTek Helio G85 Octa core chipset coupled with a Mali-G52 MC2GPU. The device will come assembled with 4GB RAM paired with an internal storage capacity of 64 GB, which can be expanded upto 256GB. Fuelling the device will be a huge 6000mAh Li-ion battery with quick charging support on board.
Software and Connectivity: Realme C25s will run Android 11 out of the box. For the connectivity options, the smartphone will support features likedual sim VoLTE(Nano + Nano), Wi-Fi 802.11, a/ac/b/g/n, GPS, and Bluetooth 5.0. Furthermore, the smartphone will also pack in a USB Type-C port, a 3.5mm headphone jack ,and a rear-mounted fingerprint sensor as well.

Overview: Indian mobile handset company Lava has expanded its affordable smartphones portfolio with a new 4G VoLTE phone — the Lava X50 Plus. In terms of the design, the phone features a metallic body along with a curved back.

In terms of the camera offerings, the Lava X50 Plus carries an 8-megapixel autofocus rear camera with LED Flash. In May 2017, Asus launched a new smartphone thereby adding another new member to its affordable Zenfone Go series which was dubbed as the Asus Zenfone Go 5.5 (ZB552KL). The unique attractive feature about this device was its large 5.5-inch display.

Design and Display
In terms of design, the offering from Asus sports a look familiar with other devices from the company - a physical button at the front with the volume rocker making its appearance at the back. The phone is sleek to hold and quite ergonomic. On the display front, the smartphone features a 5.5-inch HD IPS LCD panel having a resolution of  720 x 1280 pixels. The display reproduces a pixel density of about 267 PPI making the display moderately crisp to view.

Camera
In the photography department, the Zenfone Go 5.5 packs in a 13-megapixel primary camera located at the back having an aperture of f/2.0. The camera module is also coupled with a dual-tone LED flash for capturing images in low light. Up front, Asus has equipped the device with 5-megapixel selfie camera to capture images and video calling purposes.

Performace and Storage
Under its massive screen, the Zenfone Go is powered by a quad-core Snapdragon 410 made by Qualcomm clocked at 1.2 GHz. The smartphone is also equipped with an Adreno 306 GPU and 2 GB of RAM for a seamless user interface. In the storage department, the phone ships in a 16GB and 32GB internal storage variant; both of which can be further expanded up to 128GB through its onboard microSD card slot. The phone runs Asus' custom Asus ZenUI 3.0 UI which is built upon Android 6.0 Marshmallow.

Battery and Connectivity
The phone, under its body, packs in a 3,000mAh battery that should get it well through a day's use. As far as connectivity is concerned, the Zenfone features support for Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n, GPS, Bluetooth 4.0, and a microUSB connector.

Chinese tech firm Lenovo launched the K8 in September. It comes as a successor to K6 launched last year in India. The phone falls in mid-range price segment. Let’s take a look at what the phone has to offer.
Display and Design:

The Lenovo K8 features a 5.2 inch LCD screen with 1280 x 720 pixel resolution. It is sturdy built and feels premium in hands due to its metal body. The phone comes in two colors: Venom Black & Fine Gold. The volume & power buttons are on the right while on the left there is sim card & microSD card slot. The phone also features fingerprint sensor and a 3.5mm headphone jack.
Camera:

The Lenovo K8 features a 13MP rear camera with PDAF & LED flash. PDAF helps you click good low light pictures. On the front, Lenovo has added an 8MP sensor for clicking selfies. The rear camera is also capable of recording full HD videos (1080p)
Performance, Storage & OS:

Under the hood, the Lenovo K8 runs on MediaTek octa-core processor with 2.3Ghz processor speed coupled by 3GB of RAM. The K8 runs on Android 7.1 Nougat.
Battery & Connectivity:

The Lenovo K8 packs a massive 4000 mAh non-removable battery which is enough to last for a day without charging. It is a dual sim smartphone that accepts nano sim. On the connectivity front the phone offers 4G, 3G, 2G networks, along with WiFi, Bluetooth and VoLTE.

Introduction:: Reliance launched LYF Flame 6 mobile in India in June 2016. It comes with a quad-core processor, fast call connection, slow motion video capture and True 4G support.
Display and Design:: The LYF Flame 6 comes with a 4 inch touchscreen display with resolution of 800 x 480 pixels and a pixel density of 218PPI. The screen comes with Asahi Dragontrail glass protection. The phone weighs around 162 grams and has size dimensions of 126 x 64 x 10.6 mm. It is available in Black color with curvy Golden Bezel. It has easy grip and single hand navigation capability.
Hardware & Features:: The LYF Flame 6 is powered by 1.3GHz quad-core processor and it runs on Android 5.1 version (Lollipop). The phone has some sensors including gyroscope, proximity sensor, ambient light, and accelerometer.
Camera & Storage:: The LYF Flame 6 offers a primary camera of 2MP and front camera of 2MP. It comes with a 512MB RAM and 4GB internal memory which can be expanded up to 32GB by micro SD card. The camera has certain additional features like smile shutter, face detection, anti-banding and slow motion video capture. The phone allows establishing of video conferencing without having the need to download any third party application.
Battery & Connectivity:: The LYF Flame 6 has a 1750mAh Li-ion removable battery. The phone offers dual SIM facility (regular and micro SIM) and offers 2G/3G/4G LTE with one SIM using 4G. Other connectivity options includes Bluetooth 4.0, Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n, FM and USB support.
Competition:: Alternatives to this phone are Micromax Canvas Spark 2 Plus and Intex Aqua Q7 that have more battery capacity, more color variants, more camera resolution and more internal storage but lower processor speed. Another differentiation is the support for WiFi and Bluetooth for connectivity.

The battery of 2600mAh may not be the best, but can last a day with average usage.

Meizu, a Chinese smartphone company, first made its presence in the Indian market in 2015 with Meizu m2 Note and after that, the company has launched a range of smartphones to keep the spirit alive. Now, the Meizu M5 is the company’s latest smartphone, which comes with VoLTE support.

The Meizu M5 sports a 5.2-inch HD display with a resolution of 1280 x 720 pixels. The phone also gets 2.5D glass on top. In China, the phone was launched in two variants – one with 2GB RAM and 16GB internal storage and another one with 3GB RAM and 32GB internal storage. The phone also gets five color options including glacier white, matte black, mint green, champagne gold and sapphire blue.

The Meizu M5 is equipped with an octa-core MediaTek MT6750 processor clocked at 1.8GHz. It runs on Flyme OS 5.5 which is built on the top of Android 5.1 Lollipop. Talking about camera, the Meizu M5 features a 13-megapixel primary camera with dual-tone LED flash and PDAF. It also flaunts a secondary 5-megapixel camera for capturing selfies. The phone also sports a front fingerprint scanner mounted on the home button.

It is a Dual SIM phone and supports two Nano SIM cards. It packs in a 3,070mAh battery which company claims to provide 66 hours of continuous music playback. Other connectivity feature includes Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n, Bluetooth 4.0, GPS/A-GPS. The phone measures dimension of 147.28×72.8x8mm and weighs 138 grams.

The Vivo Y25 runs an outdated Android 5.1 Lollipop-based Funtouch OS 2.1. Vivo states it results in longer running time, smoother operation, and powerful software experience. One can easily customise several software-level functionalities such as lock-screen avatar, visitor mode, and global search.

On the front, the Vivo Y25 has a 4.5-inch FWVGA display featuring 854 x 480 pixels resolution. The phone is powered by a MediaTek MTK6580 quad-core processor clocked at 1.3GHz. The set of supported sensors under the hood includes accelerometer, proximity, and photosensitive sensor.

In terms of photography, the Vivo Y25 houses a 5-megapixel rear camera as well as a 2MP selfie camera. Some of the supported camera modes and features include voice capture, palm capture, panorama, HDR, and more. It measures 130.7 mm in height, 66.4 mm in width and 9.2 mm in thickness, and packs 1900mAh battery.
The Vivo Y25 is based on some of the standard set of connectivity options like 4G, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, OTG, GPS, and microUSB port.

Pros: Front facing speakers with Dolby ATMOS technology
Cons: Very slipper back panel, cover is recommended
Below average camera output in low-light conditions

Overview: The Panasonic Eluga i2 Activ is a budget offering by smartphone maker Panasonic. It packs in decent specifications and features for a phone of this price range. Let's take a look at what the phone has to offer.
Design & Display:

Design of the phone is just like you would expect from a phone of this budget. The phone can be availed in three different colours: Gold, Rose Gold and Grey. Coming to the display, the Eluga I2 Activ fits a 5-inch HD display which provides a resolution of 1280 x 720 pixels. The display can be termed as decent at best.
Camera:

In terms of camera, there is an 8-megapixel rear camera which is capable of clicking pictures and shooting videos. The phone also gets a 5-megapixel front camera for clicking selfies and video calling.
Performance & Storage:

On the specifications front, the phone is powered by a quad-core MediaTek MT6737 processor clocked at 1.25GHz. It has also got 1GB RAM to allow the phone to multi-task. The phone runs on Android 7.0 Nougat without any custom UI. 16GB of internal storage is provided in the phone but for those who seek to upgrade the storage can do so by putting a microSD card of up to 128GB.
Battery & Connectivity:

The Panasonic Eluga I2 Active houses a 2200mAh battery which cannot be removed by the user. It can last up to a day at max on an average. On the connectivity front, the phone has got Wi-Fi 802.11b/g/n, Bluetooth, Micro-USB port with OTG support, GPS, and a 3.5mm audio jack.
Nubia added the Nubia M2 Lite its M-series lineup in May 2017. The M2 Lite was nubia’s first phone to sport a powerful 16-megapixel front-facing camera aimed at the selfie-enthusiasts.

Display and Design
The offering from nubia features a sleek metal unibody design measuring at just 7.5mm in thickness. In terms of its screen, the smartphone sports a 5.5-inch HD TFT display bearing a resolution of 1280 x 720 pixels thereby capable of reproducing a pixel density of about 267 PPI. To top that off, the M2 Lite also features 2.5D glass on top of its display for an enhanced user experience.

Performance and Storage
Under the hood, the phone is powered by an octa-core MediaTek MT6750 processor paired with 4GB of RAM and 32GB of internal storage, which can be expanded up to 128GB through a microSD card. The phone also packs in a Mali-T860MP2 GPU for graphics-intensive use.

Camera
For photography purposes, the nubia M2 Lite packs in a 13-megapixel rear-facing camera having an aperture of f/2.2. The primary camera is capable of recording videos in 1080p at up to 30 frames per second. Up front, the phone sports a 16-megapixel selfie camera featuring a CMOS sensor.

Battery and Connectivity
The phone is powered up by a 3000mAh battery enhanced with new power optimisation features that should aid in helping the smartphone last well over a day. As for connectivity, the phone supports dual-band Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n/a, Bluetooth 4.0, 3.5mm audio jack and a microUSB port.

Itel's upcoming mid-ranger dubbed Itel Vision 2 is one of the cheapest devices of all time. This device also has the potential to be crowned as the next mid-range killer. Not just that but the smartphone also packs in a great value for money and some amazing specs for the price such as a beautiful AMOLED display, a huge 4000mAh battery, a great camera setup, and a lot more. The smartphone is powered by the Tru-Octa Core SoC.
Design and Display: The Itel Vision 2boasts a 6.6 inch IPS LCDdisplay with a resolution of 720 x 1600 pixelsand a high pixel density of 266ppi to fabricate rich and crisp visuals. The bezel-less display sports an immersive Punch-hole design along with an aspect ratio of 20:9 and a screen to body ratio of 90% for enhanced viewing experience.
Cameras: The Itel Vision 2 houses a dual rear camera with a 13MP wide-angle primary sensor and a 2MP macro sensor with LED flash support onboard. Coming to the front, the device features a 8MP selfie shooter. The camera arrives with features likeArtificial Intelligence, Auto Flash, Auto Focus, Bokeh Effect, Continuos Shooting, Exposure compensation, Face detection, Geo tagging, High Dynamic Range mode (HDR), ISO control, Touch to focus, White balance presets.
Battery and Performance: The Itel Vision 2 is baked with the Tru-Octa Core chipset coupled with an Adreno 620GPU. The device comes assembled with 2GB RAM paired with an internal storage capacity of 32GB, which can be expanded upto 128GB. Fuelling the device is a huge 4000mAh Li-ion battery with fast charging support on board.
Software and Connectivity: Itel Vision 2 will run Android Go UI on top of Android 10 out of the box. For the connectivity options, the smartphone will support features likedual sim VoLTE(Nano + Nano), Wi-Fi 802.11, b/g/n, GPS, and Bluetooth. Furthermore, the smartphone will also pack in a microUSB 2.0 port, a 3.5mm headphone jack , USB OTG support and a rear-mounted fingerprint sensor as well.

Overview: The Motorola Moto G Second Generation is one of the most popular smartphones in the budget smartphone category. Initially at launch in September 2014, Motorola had decided to launch the phone with only support for 3G. However, with a fierce competition from the likes of Xiaomi RedMi 2 Prime, Lenovo K3 Note and the Yu Yureka Plus in the sub Rs 10,000 category, and in order to keep the phone relevant and up to speeds, a new LTE version of what is arguably the most popular Motorola device was released in 2015. The new Moto G Second Gen from the outside is exactly the same device as the original Moto G Second Gen. If you were to go into nitty gritty details of the phone, then the LTE version weighs 6 grams more than the 3G variant and comes with Android Lollipop out of the box. The only major specification change has been in the battery capacity where, the LTE version comes with a 2390 mAh battery as compared to the 2070 mAh battery on the 3G version.

Other hardware specs of the phone remain the same as the 3G variant of Moto G Second Gen. The LTE version comes with a 5 inch LCD panel with 720 P resolution which gives the phone a pixel density of 294 PPI. The phone is powered by Qualcomm MSM8926 Snapdragon 400 chipset, which is a Quad Core processor. Moto G Second Gen LTE version is available only in 16 GB memory variant in India at launch and has a slot for Micro SD card. RAM on the device is slightly disappointing at 1 GB, which proves to be a bit of a stumbling block if you like to have too many things running simultaneously. The rear camera is 8 MP while the front snapper is 2 MP for the selfie lovers. You get an option of picking the phone in black or white variants and can replace the back plate on the phone with a plate in the colour of your choice, giving the phone that added a bit of personality.
Alternatives
Lenovo A6000
Samsung Galaxy On5
Micromax Canvas Nitro 4G

Yu Yureka 2 is a successor to the previously launched Yureka by Yu Televentures, a subsidiary of Mircomax. This is a feature packed phone in a good budget, check out all the details you need to know about the phone.
Design & Display:
In terms of design, the Yu Yureka 2 has a metal unibody design which looks premium. Currently, the phone is only available only in a single colour: Champagne Gold.

The phone packs in a 5-inch Full HD display which provides a resolution of 1920 x 1080 pixels. This raises the pixel density to 401PPI which is pretty appreciable. To make it feel even better, it has a 2.5D curved glass on top of it.
Camera:

The Yu Yureka 2 also packs in a good camera, both in the front as well as on the rear. In the rear, the phone has a 16-megapixel sensor which is then accompanied by a dual-tone LED flash to make pictures in low-light seem more natural. For selfie lovers, the phone also comes with a 8-megapixel front camera which is capable of clicking some really good selfies.
Performance & Storage:

For a superior performance, the phone is powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 625 processor. It works in sync with the 4GB RAM provided to pull off seamless multi-tasking. To ensure that the graphic performance is up to the mark, the phone also houses the Adreno 506 graphic processor.
The phone provides 64GB of internal storage which can also be expanded with the help of a microSD slot up to 128GB. Since it has a hybrid slot, you can either use two SIM's or a microSD card.
Battery & Connectivity:
The Yu Yureka 2 packs in a solid battery pack which measures 3930mAh. Even charging the massive battery is quite quick as the phone comes with Qualcomm Quick Charge 3.0 technology.

There are multiple connectivity options provided in the phone which include a 3.5mm audio jack and a Micro USB port. Wireless connectivity options such as 4G LTE, 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth and VoLTE are provided in the phone as well.

Pros: Handy form factor, good for one handed usage
8MP camera sensors on the back and front of the device are decent
Cons: Sluggish multitasking despite having 2GB of RAM
Battery life is just about average

Overview: The Gionee S11 Lite is a mid-segment smartphone with trending features like bezel-less display & a dual rear camera. Let’s take a look at its overview to find more about this device:
Display & Design:

The Gionee S11 Lite sports a 5.7-inch FullView bezel-less display. It supports HD resolution of 1440 x 720 pixels. The display is tucked under Corning Gorilla Glass for protection against accidental damage and scratches. Design-wise, the S11 lite looks quite stylish. There are sensors like accelerometer, proximity sensor and magnetometer. The S11 lite ships in Dark Blue color variant.
Camera:

On the camera front, the S11 Lite features a dual rear camera setup of 13MP primary sensor assisted by a 2MP secondary sensor. There is a 16MP front snapper that is capable of clicking great selfie images. It is also used for unlocking the phone by scanning the face. The camera software has Bokeh selfies and Face beauty features for enhancing selfie shots.
Performance, Storage & OS:

In terms of hardware, the S11 Lite is powered by a 1.4GHz Qualcomm Snapdragon 430 octa-core processor. It packs 4GB RAM for seamless multitasking and a Adreno 505 graphics processor onboard for gaming purposes. For storing your data, the S11 Lite offers 32GB internal memory which can be expanded up to 256GB via microSD card for additional storage needs. In terms of operating system, the S11 Lite runs on Android 7.1 Nougat OS out of the box.
Battery & Connectivity:

Under the hood, the S11 Lite is powered by a 3030 mAh battery which is not removable by the user. It functions as a dual SIM smartphone and requires nano SIM cards for functioning. All the basic connectivity options for networking are included like 4G LTE, 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth and VoLTE.
Lava Iris X8 is yet another budget Android smartphone. It is an upgrade to Lavas Iris X5. It looks strikingly similar to the iPhone 4. For the price it has decent amount of specifications.
Here are some of the key features of the Iris X8:
Yu Yureka
Redmi Note 4G

Overview: Aggressively pushing new smartphones around Rs. 10,000 price range this time, Samsung has another, slightly different segment product out here. The Galaxy J Max from Samsung is the latest phone in the J series, however Galaxy J Max can be misunderstood for a tablet, thanks to the huge 7 inch display. With this big screen the phone competes with a couple of devices from Lenovo, the Lenovo Phab and the Lenovo Phab Plus. Also, considering the specs of the Galaxy J max, it is expected that it would priced under 15,000 only with the above to competitors.

In terms of design the phone looks typically Samsung with plastic body and sides that look metal. The rear sports a camera with a speaker grill beside and on the front is the typical Samsung home button. Coming to the huge 7 inch display, it has a resolution of 1280x800 pixels that gives the display a pixel density of 216PPI. The clarity of the display is just average and we would expect at least Full HD resolution on a screen this big. Unfortunately, we do not get an AMOLED display and no Gorilla Glass either.

On the inside, Galaxy J Max runs a Spreadtrum SC8830 Quad Core chipset clocked at 1.5GHz and along with it is just 1.5GB of RAM. Considering the quite unheard processor and given just 1.5GB of RAM this phone might just not be able to keep up to your multitasking needs. And on the software end, the phone's operating system is based on Android 5.1 Lollipop out of the box with Samsung's TouchWiz UI running on top of it. You can check the phones running Android Marshmallow out of the box here.

On the rear of the device lies a 8MP camera sensor that can record videos up to 720p only, which again is a huge disappointment here. The Galaxy J max also lacks an LED Flash with the rear camera. On the front also you get a very basic 2MP sensor for video calling and not that great selfies. To store all the data you get 16GB of internal storage that can be further expanded up to 200GB via a MicroSD card.

Now this where the bigger form factor of the device is useful, thanks to it we have a massive 4000mAh battery packed on the back of the device which sounds impressive and should hold up quite well. And in terms of connectivity, Samsung Galaxy J Max is a Dual SIM device that supports 4G LTE in India and also allows VoLTE.
Lenovo Phab
Lenovo Phab Plus
Asus Zenfone 2 Laser
Display & Design

The Q600 is a plastic design smartphone with removable back cover. The edges of the devices have a chrome colour, which also houses the power & volume controls. The device has standard Android controls below the display on its body. The design is a big curved and given the compact size of the device, it should be easy to handle. Xolo packs in a 4.5-inch LCD display sporting a resolution of 480x854. If you are looking for a better display at this price range, Xolo itself has the Q900s Plus that you can consider.
Hardware & Features

With the backing of a MediaTek MT6589 processor that is clocked at 1.2GHz the Q600 doesn’t lack horsepower. However the Quad-core processor is paired with a basic 512MB RAM which also explains why this device runs on Android Jellybean. The phone also features a FM Radio and weighs just under 150 gms. The device has a 3.5mm audio jack for music listeners and a Micro USB port.
Camera & Storage
Battery & Connectivity

The phone is powered by a 2000mAh battery that is removable and replaceable. Xolo offers 3G connectivity, Dual SIM support, wireless internet and bluetooth on this device. You may want to also look at the Xolo Era 4K (with 2GB RAM) if shopping for a budget smartphone.

Intro:: Panasonic Eluga A2 was launched in April, 2016. The storage capacity is the main attraction of this device. Users can expand the memory of the device up to 128 GB. This is the only phone providing a massive 3GB RAM in this price bracket.
Display and Design:: The 5 inch LCD screen provides an HD graphics with output resolution of 1280 x 720 pixels and 294PPI pixel density. It has multi capacitive touchscreen that provides 16M colors. It has a metallic body and is available in Gold and Silver colors. Its size is 143.8 x 72 x 8.9 mm and weight is 168 grams.
Hardware & Features:: Panasonic Eluga A2 has a 1GHz MediaTek MT6735M quad-core processor, 3GB RAM and Android 5.1 Lollipop OS. Some of its built-in features include accelerometer, proximity sensor, ambient light sensor and gyroscope. Some applications like WhatsApp and Facebook are also pre-installed in the device.
Camera & Storage:: The device has an 8MP rear and a 5MP front camera with an Autofocus facility and LED flashlight.  One can record HD video and images simultaneously. The camera is equipped with face detection, digital stabilization and digital zoom facility. It has a 16GB internal memory that can be expanded up to 128GB with a microSD card.
Battery & Connectivity:: It has a Lithium-Ion (Li-Ion) 4000 mAh non removable battery that provides backup for long hours. Users of this phone can enjoy both 3G and 4G connectivity with the Dual SIM device. Connectivity options like Bluetooth, Wi-Fi and Hotspot, VoLTE features are available in the device.

Overview: Oppo has been known to focus on the build material and design of their phones and with the Oppo Neo 5 has done it again, this time at a very low cost compared to what price range Oppo targets.The Oppo Neo 5 comes with Metal sides and has Glass on front and back of the device.
Lets have a look at the detailed specifications of the device:

Zen Cinemax 4G is the company’s yet another 4G VoLTE-enabled smartphone with a budget pricing.

The Zen Cinemax 4G sports a 5.5-inch FWVGA display with a resolution of 856 x 480 pixels. The phone features a Swalekh keyboard which comes pre-installed with 22 different Indian languages such as Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Marathi, Punjabi and much more. Under the hood, the Zen Cinemax is equipped with a quad-core processor clubbed with 2GB RAM. The phone also gets 16GB of internal storage which is further expandable up to 32GB with a MicroSD card.

As stated earlier, it is 4G VoLTE-enabled with dual SIM support. Coming to the camera section, the Zen Cinemax features a 5-megapixel camera on both front and rear sides. The rear camera is also accompanied with a LED flash. It runs Android 6.0 Marshmallow.

The phone also comes with pre-loaded with apps such as Saavn, Zen Care, and Zen Store. It packs in a 2,900mAh battery which company claims to provide 30 hours of standby time. Zen Mobile also provides free screen replacement warranty for first six months. It is available in two colors – Champagne and Rose Gold.

Intro:: The company has came up with Meizu M2 Note in June 2015.
Display and Design: The smartphone flaunts 5.5-inch screen (1080x1920 pixels) along with a pixel density of 403PPI. The device adorned with a polycarbonate rear panel beautified with matte finish has got dimensions as 150.9x75.2x8.7 mm and at a weight of 149g. Safe from drops and scratches owing to the screen panel built with tempered glass, this one is offered in magnificent shades of blue, pink, gray and white.
Hardware and Features: The device has been embedded with Octa-core MediaTek MT6753 processor that runs at 1.3GHz processing speed. Mali T720-MP3 GPU present in the device makes it easy for the users to have amazing gaming experience with rich graphics. The USP of the device is its Flyme 4.5 UI running on top of Lollipop 5.1. Usual array of sensors include Gyroscope, Proximity Sensor, Accelerometer and Ambient light sensors.
Camera and Storage: It lets the user to capture the lifetime moments and memories with the rear shooter of 13MP with the features as dual-tone LED flash, 4K video recording support and low-light photography through image signal processor. Selfie-centric front camera with a special beauty mode allows capture with the 5MP front snapper. This piece from Meizu comes with 2GB RAM  and has got internal storage of 16 or 32GB and an expandable memory up to 128GB.
Battery and Connectivity: 3100mAh non-removable battery enables the device to run for longer time periods. The device supports dual SIM with the one 4G supportive slot. Other connectivity options include 3G, dual-band Wi-Fi, Wi-Fi Direct, Wi-Fi Hotspot, Bluetooth 4.0, and GPS.
Competition: Meizu M2 Note is a budget Smartphone that is complete value for money and scores high on design. The primary competitors include Lenovo K3 Note, Phicomm Passion 660 and Xiaomi Redmi Note 2.

Overview: Chinese handset maker Zopo has added a new phone to its Color lineup – the Zopo Color F2. Zopo had an event scheduled in Mumbai this year where it unveiled its new phone in India. Previously, Zopo launched two phones in its portfolio of “Color” devices in the country such as Color F1, Color C3, and Color F5. Zopo is apparently looking compete with already-established Chinese brands such as Xiaomi, Vivo, and the likes on Indian soil.

This is what the Zopo Color F2 has to offer: It comes with a 5.5-inch HD IPS display. Furthermore, the display is covered by 2.5D Curved Glass. The smartphone is powered by a 64-Bit MediaTek MT6737 quad-core processor coupled with 2GB of RAM. However, we are yet to confirm its clock speed. The device further embraces 16GB of internal storage that is expandable up to 64GB through microSD card.

On the camera front, the Zopo Color F2 features an 8-megapixel rear camera with LED flash. The camera is also combined with a 5-megapixel front shooter for selfies. The Dual-SIM Zopo Color F2 is based on Android 6.0 Marshmallow operating system. The smartphone keeps up with a 2300mAh battery. Connectivity options include 4G LTE, Wi-Fi 802.11 a/g/b/n, Bluetooth 4.0, GPS, and microUSB.

Interestingly, there is a fingerprint scanner mounted at the back which is multifunctional. Meaning, it allows users to control video, audio playback, and more. Available in Champagne Gold and Rose Gold colour options, the Zopo Color F2 is priced at Rs 10,790 in India.

Chinese handset maker Zopo has been consistent at launching smartphones that fall under an entry-level or affordable segment. In spite of launching numerous devices in the Indian market over last few months, the company is playing on the back foot and has not been able to stand out so far. This time, however, it may not be the case since Zopo is aiming for something bigger, something it has not done for almost a year.

Back in July last year, Zopo launched a flagship phone the Speed 8 in India, which is currently retailing in India at Rs 20,000. Since then, Zopo did not refresh its Speed lineup that kind of vowed itself to a high-end segment. Keeping this in mind, Zopo decided to refresh its flagship lineup with a new device dubbed Zopo Speed X, which is expected to arrive in India sometime later this month.

The key highlight is the company’s first dual camera smartphone. It sports a 13-megapixel primary camera that works with a 2-megapixel secondary camera. In addition, it supports face beauty mode, time lapse mode, and more. Up front, there is a mammoth the 13MP selfie camera with front flash, making it selfie-centric.

Design-wise, the Zopo Speed X boasts of a unibody metal design that weighs 131g. Coming to the connectivity, Zopo Speed X is a Dual SIM phone and features 4G VoLTE, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS/AGPS, FM Radio, 3.5mm audio jack, and Micro-USB port.

Introduction:: Wind 5 is a dual SIM device that was launched in June 2016. USB OTG facility for using pen drive is a major highlight. It also has some impressive camera features like smile detection, gesture capture, multi angle view, panorama and more.
text: Wind 5 can face direct competition from Xolo Era 4G as both are available in similar price range with somewhat similar features. But Wind 5 has better rear and front camera than Xolo Era 4G.

Overview: Intex India has launched several devices in the sub 5000 segment. While many of the previous phones didn’t even support 4G LTE, these new phones do have 4G LTE support and are also VoLTE enabled which is now a must, thanks to Reliance Jio.

Intex Aqua Raze is a decent looking device with handy form factor, however considering the price segment do not expect anything fancy but a plasticky build. And thanks to the 4.5 inch display, the phone feels quite handy and can be used easily with single hand. The 4.5 inch display has got a resolution of 854x480 pixels giving it a pixel density of 218PPI and we do not have any sort of protection over the display.

Coming to what sits underneath the Intex Aqua Raze, is a MediaTek MT6735M Quad Core chipset clocked at 1GHz and paired with is 1GB of RAM. And on the software end, the device runs on Android 5.1 Lollipop out of the box and no future software update is expected. Besides, the phone does not have any exceptional feature worth mentioning.

On the back of the device we have a 5MP camera along with an LED Flash whereas on the front we have a very basic 2MP camera. On the storage front, Intex Aqua Raze comes with 8GB of onboard storage that can be further expanded up to 128GB via a MicroSD card.

To power the device, there is a 1800mAh battery which might not last you through the day. Besides, the phone accepts Dual Micro SIMs and supports 4G LTE Indian bands with VoLTE out of the box. You also get the standard Bluetooth and WiFi with Intex Aqua Raze.
LYF Flame 7
Intex Cloud Fame
Micromax Canvas Spark 2 Plus
Karbonn has launched a new device in the sub 5000 segment. The Karbonn K9 Viraat is a very basic device to serve just about basic purposes with some interesting features.

The design is good in terms of looks but the build is plasticky as expected, it does not feel anything more. On the front of the phone sits a 5.5 inch display that has a resolution of 1280x720 (HD) pixels giving it a pixel density of 267PPI and does not sound that sharp to look at. And unfortunately, there is't any sort of protection over the display.

Karbonn K9 Viraat gets a MediaTek MT6580 Quad Core processor and is clocked at 1.3GHz. You also get 1GB of RAM combined along. The only plus about this phone can be that it runs on the latest Android 6.0 Marshmallow out of the box, however you should not expect any updates from Karbonn for the device. Apart from this there isn't any other special feature worth mentioning.

On the back of the device you get a 5MP sensor that can record videos up to 720p and for low light conditions you get an LED Flash. On the front there is 2MP camera for video calling or not that great selfies but you do get an LED Flash on the front as well. To store all the data, Karbonn K9 Viraat comes with 8GB of internal storage and you also get expansion option up to 64GB via a MicroSD card.

To power the Karbonn K9 Viraat, there is surprisingly big 2800mAh removable battery and in terms of connectivity you get Dual SIM device but unfortunately lacks 4G LTE and VoLTE connectivity. Apart from that you get standard Bluetooth and WiFi connectivity.
