To add to its budget smartphone portfolio, Karbonn launched a new smartphone in May 2017 dubbed as the Aura Power 4G. The phone ships in two colour variants viz Champagne and Grey.

Display and Design
In terms of design, the offering from Karbonn sports a metal finish for superior grip and ergonomics. On the front, along with its screen are three capacitive keys whereas the back is where the camera bump and LED flash are located. On the display front, the phone features a 5-inch HD IPS LCD display having a resolution of 1280 x 720 pixels.

Camera
On the camera front, the device packs in a 5-megapixel rear camera with dual LED flash for capturing images in low light. On the front, there is another 5-megapixel sensor for capturing selfies and making video calls.

Performance and Storage
Underneath its hood, the Karbonn Aura Power 4G Plus is powered by a quad-core processor clocking at 1.3GHz backed up with 1GB of RAM. In terms of storage, the device ships with 16GB of internal storage which can be expanded up to 32GB through the microSD card slot.

Battery and Connectivity
The offering from Karbonn packs in a 4000mAh non-removable Li-ion battery pack which should last the user well over a day. In terms of connectivity, the device offers support for 4G VoLTE, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 4.0, GPS, and a 3.5mm audio jack.
Lava in an effort to expand its affordable A-series lineup launched, another smartphone in May 2017 called as the Karbonn A77. The phone ships in three colour variants viz.  Blue, Gold, and Grey.

Design and Display
In terms of design, the A77 features a metal body portraying a premium build for a smartphone with a not so premium price tag. On the back of the device is its primary camera, some branding from Karbonn, antenna lines running through the upper and lower edges and a rear firing loudspeaker grill. The front of the device is shared by its screen, three capacitive buttons, earpiece grill and camera sensors. As far as the display goes, the smartphone features a 480p IPS LCD panel having a resolution of 800 x 480 pixels.

Camera
For photography purposes, the A77 sports a 5-megapixel camera at the rear which is coupled with an LED flash for capturing images in low light. On the front, the phone features a selfie camera which comprises of a 5-megapixel sensor as well. The rear-facing camera is capable of recording videos in up to 720p.

Performance and Storage
Underneath its hood, the offering from Karbonn is powered by a quad-core processor clocking at 1.3GHz. To bolster the processor, the smartphone also packs in 1GB of RAM for multitasking and an overall lag-free user interface. The Karbonn A77 ships with 8GB of internal storage which can be expanded up to 32GB through the microSD card slot.

Battery and Connectivity
The budget smartphone from Karbonn draws its power from a 2000mAh removable Li-ion battery unit. This battery is removable which makes it more convenient for you to swap the battery in case you are both short of time and out of charge. As far as connectivity is concerned, the phone offers support for all the standard options like WiFi, Bluetooth, GPS, 4G VoLTE, a 3.5mm headphone jack and USB 2.0 through the micro USB connector located at the bottom.

text.Design and Display: Gionee has launched a new device priced around Rs.6000, the Gionee P5W is launched and available in 5 colors viz; Black, Blue, Red, White and Yellow.
text.Specifications and Software: As expected from any device in this budget, the Gionee P5W gets a Plastic body which looks like the iPhone 5C with all the color options available. On the front sits a 5 inch HD (1280x720pixels) display which sounds sharp enough for a 5 inch display and gives the display a total pixel density of 294PPI.
text.Camera and Storage: On the inside is a MediaTek MT6735 Quad Core chipset clocked at 1.3GHz and combined with it is just 1GB of RAM. The processor sounds decent for performing very basic tasks but the 1GB RAM is a major draw back since at least 2GB of RAM is needed to have a good multitasking experience. On the software front Gionee P5W's operating system is based on Android 5.1 Lollipop out of the box with no details on future updates whatsoever.
text.Battery and Connectivity: On the rear of the device you get a 5MP sensor that can record videos up to 720p, whereas on the front is just 2MP camera. The rear camera also gets an LED Flash to take shots and record videos at night. Coming to storage, you get 16GB of internal storage which can be further expanded up to 32GB via a MicroSD card.
text.Alternatives:: Powering the device is a 2000mAh user replaceable battery which sounds quite low which makes us doubt if it will last through a whole working day. The Phone accepts Dual Micro SIMs but lacks 4G LTE connectivity.

Introduction:: Itel It1511 is a dual SIM device that was launched in June 2016. Oncell display, 5 point touch support, capacitive touchscreen, excellent faux leather frame, metallic finish and 4G support are its major highlights.
Display and Design:: Itel It1511 is equipped with 5 inch HD touchscreen TFT IPS display, 1280 x 720 pixels resolution and 294PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 138.5 x 69.5 x 9.8 mm and weight of 155 grams. It is available in 2 colours including champagne Gold and Black.
Hardware and Features:: This dual SIM device comes with 1GHz 64 bit quad-core MediaTek MT6735P processor, 1GB RAM, Mali-T720 for graphics and Android 6.1 Marshmallow operating system. G sensor, light sensor and proximity sensor are in-built.
Camera and Storage:: It comes with 8MP rear and 2MP front camera with dual flash. Geotagging and autofocus features are available. This dual SIM device has an internal storage of 8GB that can be expanded up to 64GB with a micro SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:: Itel It1511 is loaded with a removable Li-Po battery of 2500mAh that lets the users enjoy a talk time of up to 20 hours in 2G network and up to 13 hours in 3G network. The users can get a standby time of nearly 308 hours. Users can enjoy connectivity through Wi-Fi 802.11a/b/g/n, Bluetooth BT 4.0, GSM 900/1800/1900 MHz, EDGE, GPS, AGPS, OTG and LTE.
Competition:: Itel It1511 faces competition from slightly higher priced mobile phones like Coolpad Note 3 Lite and Swipe Elite Plus. However, when considering features, Coolpad Note 3 Lite has better rear and front camera and bigger RAM than Itel It1511. Also, Swipe Elite Plus has better camera, higher capacity and RAM than Itel It1511.

Overview: The Moto C is the first smartphone by Motorola in the C-series. The phone lies in the low-budget price range and comes with decent features and specifications. Let's take a look at what the phone has to offer its users.
Design & Display:

Although the Moto C has a decent design, it misses out on having a metal body. The design is ergonomic though. The phone is available in three colour variants: Starry Black, Fine Gold and Pearl White. Display of the phone spans 5 inches and provides a resolution of 854 x 480 pixels which is comparatively quite less. It has an LCD panel and lacks any kind of screen protection.
Camera:

In terms of optics, the phone sports a 5-megapixel rear camera which has fixed focus. It can record HD videos and is accompanied by an LED flash. On the front, the phone fits a 2-megapixel snapper which gets a 63-degree wide lens. Even the front camera has got an LED flash for low-light selfies.
Performance & Storage:

To pull of performance, the Moto C comes with a MediaTek MT6737M processor which is clocked at 1.1GHz. The phone also comes with 1GB of RAM to carry out multi-tasking. The phone runs on Android Nougat out of the box. With respect to storage, the phone gets 16GB of internal memory which can be expanded till 32GB via microSD card.
Battery & Connectivity:
The Moto C packs a 2350mAh battery unit which can last almost a day with moderate usage. For connectivity, it comes with Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS/A-GPS, 3.5mm audio jack, and a micro-USB port.

Pros: Features a dedicated SD card slot
It is a compact device and is easy to handle
The MediaTek processor that powers this phone isn't capable for heavy gaming
Cons: It has a heavy user interface and 1GB of RAM isn't sufficient for smooth multitasking
Android Lollipop that this phone ships with is outdated
Inbuilt storage of just 8GB is lower than devices in this price range

Overview: Karbonn Titanium Visa 4G is the company's one of the latest 4G LTE-enabled smartphone, so that users can leverage super-fast 4G LTE network and speed. On the front, it comes with a 5-inch (12.7 cm) Full HD display featuring 1920 x 1080 pixels resolution and 441 PPI pixel density.

Powering the Karbonn Titanium Vista 4G is a 1.25GHz quad-core SoC, 1GB of RAM, and 8GB of internal memory. The storage, however, is expandable up to 32GB so that you can store max. amount of files, music, videos. The device measures at 145.4 x 71.8 x 8.31 mm and weighs in at 130 grams.

In terms of photography, the Karbonn Titanium Visa 4G packs in an 8-megapixel autofocus rear camera with flash. Up front is a 5-megapixel secondary camera for selfies. Furthermore, it supports GPS so that real-time navigation turns out to be super-smooth.

The Karbonn Titanium Visa 4G comes pre-loaded with a wide variety of apps that are aimed at offering plenty to do right out of the box. Connectivity-wise, it further supports Bluetooth and Wi-Fi b/g/n, and VoLTE so that you can enjoy Reliance Jio network.
The battery inside the Karbonn Titanium Vista 4G is rated at 2300mAh out of which standby time is claimed up to 300 hours where as talk time is claimed up to 8 hours on 2G.
For more options check out the best phones under Rs. 10,000

Intro:: A2020 was launched by Lenovo in India in May 2016 as an upgrade of A2010. It is considered as the most affordable mobile phone in India, with a distinguishable high level of internal storage capacity for the range and some additional features like 5-inch FWVGA display and a Mali T720 GPU paired quad-core 64-bit processor.
Display and Design:: The phone has a 5-inch touchscreen display with resolution at 480 x 854 pixels having a pixel density of 294PPI. The screen is IPS capacitive touchscreen, 16M colors. Phone is available in Gold and Rose Gold only. Size dimensions are 143.5 x 71.8 x 9 mm and it weighs around 166 grams.
Hardware & Features:: The phone is powered by quad-core 1.1GHz processor and comes with 1GB RAM. The phone runs on Android 5.1 version (Lollipop) and has an expandable internal storage of 8GB. The phone has certain noticeable features like proximity sensor, ambient light sensor, accelerometer, gyroscope, geo-tagging, touch focus and face detection.
Camera & Storage:: The phone offers a rear camera of 5MP with LED flash and front camera of 2MP. It has a 1GB RAM and a storage of 16GB and can be expanded up to 32GB through microSD card.
Battery & Connectivity:: The phone has a removable Li-Ion 2300 mAh battery. It is a single SIM (GSM) smartphone that accepts a micro-SIM. Internet connectivity is possible with Wi-Fi 02.11 b/g/n, GPS /A-GPS, Bluetooth 4.0, and 4G LTE.
Competition:: The phone faces significant competition from cellphones like

text.Design and Display: Lava is one of the top 5 Indian smartphone manufacturer that competes with other brands like Micromax, Intex & Karbonn. The company also owns Xolo which has been recently doing well in the market with their budget oriented devices that offers good value for money. Lava X81 is a phone that has an extremely well build body with Metal Unibody construction.
text.Hardware and Features: On the front sits a 5 inch HD (1280x720) display giving the display a pixel density of 294PPI which does sound sharp enough. Unfortunately, there is no Gorilla Glass protection on the display. In terms of design, the phone looks well built and has an unibody construction. The looks of the device somewhat resembles the iPhone 6 without the antenna bands but definitely a good looking device.
text.Camera and Storage: You get a MediaTek MT6735 Quad Core chipset clocked at 1.3GHz and there is 3GB of RAM which should be great for average usage with basic apps and should provide a great multitasking experience. On the software front, Lava X81 comes with the latest Android 6.0 Marshmallow out of the box.
text.Battery and Connectivity: On the rear of Lava X81 lies a 13MP camera that can record videos up to 1080p whereas on the front sits a 5MP shooter for those selfie moments. The rear camera also gets a Dual LED Flash for taking videos and pictures in dark plus you also get an LED Flash on the front which is a huge bonus for all selfie lovers. To store all those selfies and other data there is 16GB of onboard storage with expandability option up to 32GB more via a MicroSD card.
text.Alternatives: Powering the device is a 2700mAh non removable battery that should easily last you through the day. On the connectivity front, Lava X81 supports Dual SIMs and also supports 4G LTE networks in India.

Hardware Specifications and Features:: Panasonic Eluga Note sports the same MediaTek MT6753 Octa Core chipset clocked at 1.3GHz combined with 3GB of RAM. The processor might struggle with heavy tasks but the ample 3GB of RAM should be sufficient enough to handle multitasking well. The device has no major feature, not even a fingerprint sensor.

The operating system of the device is based on Android 6.0 Marshmallow out of the box with Panasonic's FitHome UI running on top of it and there as been no info if ever it will receive Android Nougat update. Panasonic Eluga Note has plastic build material but the quality looks quite solid.

On the rear lies a 16MP sensor that can record videos up to 1080p, whereas on the front is a 5MP camera for video calling and selfies. There is also a Triple LED Flash on the rear of the device that provides ample light while taking low light shots. To store all the data you get 32GB of internal storage which can be expanded up 32GB more via a micro SD card.
Powering the device is a decent 3000mAh non-removable battery that should easily last through the day. The phone accepts Dual SIMs and supports 4G LTE connectivity with VoLTE.

Overview: Display & Design

The Eluga I3 ups the display size in comparison to the I2 with a 5.5” screen and keeps the same 720x1280 resolution. The device is made of plastic with no touch buttons on the device front. The volume rocker & power button moved to the right of the device, unlike the Eluga I2 and the speaker remains behind the device. A larger touch screen would appeal to video viewers & readers. The design of the device is largely like the standard Panasonic Eluga series.
Hardware & Features

The MediaTek 1.3Ghz processor on the device is hefty enough with a Quad-Core internal and the same is backed up with 2GB of RAM. This would be just about enough to run the custom Panasonic UI along with Android 5.1. The phone offers FM radio, GPS and Micro USB connectivity. You can buy the Eluga I3 in three colours, Rose Gold, Marine Blue & Champagne Gold.
Camera & Storage

Panasonic gives a good 13MP rear camera on this device that records full HD videos (1920x1080, 30 fps). The front camera is 5 megapixels which would count as a good selfie taker. With the onboard storage of the device being 16GB with MicroSD slot, storage won’t be an issue for most consumers.
Battery & Connectivity

Introduction:: Micromax Bolt Selfie Q424 is a dual SIM device that was launched in May 2016. Camera with face beauty mode and gesture capture, good configuration and 4G support are its major highlights.
Display and Design:: Micromax Bolt Selfie Q424 comes with a 4.5 inch LCD touchscreen FWVGA IPS display, 217.7PPI pixel density, 16M colours and 854 x 480 pixels resolution.  It is available in White and Champagne colours.
Hardware and Features:: This dual SIM device is loaded with MediaTek MT6735 processor, 1GB RAM, Android 5.1 Lollipop Operating System and Mali-T720 graphics. Gravity sensor, light sensor and proximity sensors are in-built. Pre-installed applications include Scandid, Indus, App Bazaar, App center, Ixigo cabs, Amazon shopping, Clean master, Hike, Music by Gaana, and CM security Opera mini, M!live, Quikr, Snapdeal, Travel, CM Locks and Wallet. Pre-installed games are Temple run paradise and Arjun prince of Bali. It supports MP4, 3GPP and 3GP video formats and MP3, MID, AMR, AAC and WAV audio formats.
Camera and Storage:: Micromax Bolt Selfie Q424 is equipped with 5MP AF rear and 5MP FF front camera with LED flash, autofocus and digital zoom. It has an internal memory of 8GB that can be expanded up to 32GB with a micro SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:: This dual SIM device has 1750mAh Li-Po removable battery that provides a talk time of up to 18 hours and stand by time of up to 260 hours. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, Wi-Fi and Bluetooth.
Competition:: Micromax Bolt Selfie Q424 faces competition from Yu Yunique Plus and Samsung Z2 Tizen. Both of these have faster processor and lower front camera than Bolt Selfie Q424. Samsung Z2 has smaller screen and lower battery capacity than Bolt Selfie Q424 whereas Yu Yunique Plus has bigger screen and higher battery capacity than Bolt Selfie Q424.

Overview: The Indian manufacturer Lava has launched the Lava A97 priced around Rs. 6,000 with some very average specs. The phone from Lava focuses majorly on VoLTE connectivity & have a portfolio to cover the most important spec in the country right now.

The Lava A97 comes with a plastic body with standard design & nothing exceptional to look up to. In terms of display, there is a 5-inch display with a resolution of 854x480 pixels giving it a pixel density of 196PPI.

This device comes with a Spreadtrum 1.3GHz Quad Core  processor combined with 1GB of RAM. In terms of software, it has got Android 6.0 Marshmallow out of the box with no scope of any future updates. And besides these basic, there is nothing much to expect from a budget device.

On the rear & front of the Lava A97 comes a 5MP sensor for pictures, video calling & video recording. The rear 5MP comes with an LED Flash & can shoot videos up to 720p. You get 8GB of onboard storage that can be further expanded up to 32GB via a MicroSD card.

To power the phone, Lava A97 comes with a 2350mAh battery that might just last you through a day with average usage. And in terms of connectivity, this phone has got all the major network bands supported with 4G LTE with VoLTE in India.

In May 2017, Intex launched the Aqua Zenith, another addition to the company's budget-friendly smartphone portfolio. The smartphone made its appearance alongside another offering from the OEM dubbed as the Aqua A4.

Design and Display
The smartphone sports a plastic build measuring at 9.55mm in thickness and weighing at a comfortable 143 grams, making the phone comfortable to grip. The device also features a textured back for better ergonomics. On the display front, the Aqua Zenith is equipped with a 5-inch 480p LCD display having a resolution of 854 x 480 pixels thereby bearing a pixel density of 196 PPI.

Performance and Storage
Under its hood, the Aqua Zenith is powered by a quad-core MediaTek MT6737M SoC clocking at 1.1GHz. The phone also comes with a Mali-T720 MP1 GPU paired with 1GB of RAM for improved performance. In terms of storage, the phone is packed with 8GB of internal storage which is thankfully expandable up to 256GB through its onboard microSD card slot. The phone ships with Android 7.0 Nougat out of the box.

Camera
On the camera front, the smartphone integrates a 5-megapixel primary camera located on the back with Autofocus and LED flash. Up front, the phone also features a 2-megapixel selfie camera that can be utilised for capturing images or for video calling purposes.

Battery and Connectivity
The battery on the Intex Aqua Zenith is rated at 2,000mAh, which according to the company should last up to 350-450 hours of standby time and 6-8 hours of talk time. On the connectivity front, the smartphone supports all the conventional norms such as VoLTE, Wi-Fi 802.11b/g/n, Bluetooth, FM Radio, 3.5mm jack, USB 2.0, and GPS.

Overview: Chinese phone maker Zopo Mobiles has expanded its Color lineup with a new phone, the Zopo Color F5. Earlier, Zopo launched the Color F1 in India which comes at Rs 8,999. In terms of the specifications, the Zopo Color F5 comes with a 5-inch HD IPS display with 2.5D curved glass and 293 PPI pixel density. The phone is powered by a 64-Bit Quad-Core MediaTek MT6737 clocked at 1.3GHz and 1GB RAM.zopo-color-f5

The Zopo Color F5 comes with a limited 16GB of internal storage which is expandable via microSD card. It has a metal frame on the side. Although we could not confirm, it looks like (from the picture) the Zopo Color F5 has a textured plastic back. It also features a fingerprint scanner on the back which sits right below the rear camera.

For photography, the device houses an 8-megapixel primary autofocus camera on the back with f/2.8 aperture LED flash. It also offers a 2-megapixel front shooter with f/2.8 aperture for all the selfie lovers out there. It is a Dual-SIM device which packs in a 2100mAh battery.

The Zopo Color F5 also features a floating video integration that makes it possible for users to play videos while using other apps. It has the standard set of connectivity options such as 4G LTE, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and GPS. The phone also comes with a number of sensors such as Gravity, Accelerometer, Range, and Light.
Available in Black, White, and Gold colour options, the Zopo Color F5 is priced at Rs 10,590 in India.

Introduction:: LYF Wind 3 is a dual SIM device that was launched in August 2016. The phone comes with a matte finish and curved edges giving it a stylish look. It provides a good internal memory and most of the sensor features.
text: This dual SIM device comes with 5.5 inch IPS LCD touchscreen display, 1280 x 720 pixels resolution and 233PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 152.6 x 76.6 x 9.4 mm and it weighs 159.2 grams. It provides 16M colors and 5 point multi-touch support. It is available in Black and White colors.

LYF Wind 3 is loaded with 1.2GHz quad-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 410 processor, Adreno 306 graphics, 2GB RAM and Android 5.0 Lollipop Operating System. Gravity sensor, e-compass, proximity sensor, ambient light sensor, accelerometer are in-built. FM radio, GPS are available.

This dual SIM device comes with an 8MP rear camera and 2MP front camera. Touch Focus, Auto Focus, LED Flash, Face Detection, Manual HDR, Panorama features are available. Users can record full HD videos at 1080p and 30FPS. QR code scanning and creation facility are present to provide rapid access to websites, emails and messages.

Overview: Indian cell phone maker Ziox Mobile introduced a new affordable phone dubbed as Ziox Astra Metal 4G. As the name suggests, it flaunts a metal unibody design with antenna bands at top and bottom. It comes in rose silver, gold, and champagne gold colour options. The device is already available to purchase from leading retail store across the country.

The Dual-SIM Ziox Astra Metal 4G comes with a 5-inch screen. Internally, the phone is powered by a 1.3GHz quad-core processor paired with 1GB RAM. It features an 8GB of onboard storage, expandable up to 32GB by means of a microSD card support. It runs Android 6.0 Marshmallow operating system out-of-the-box.

In terms of photography, Ziox Astra Metal 4G sports a 5MP autofocus primary camera on the back with LED flash. It also houses a 2MP secondary camera on the front for capturing selfies. Completing the package is a 3000mAh battery in addition to connectivity options i.e. 4G VoLTE, Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, GPS, and microUSB port.

Pros: Good built quality and feels premium
Cons: 1.5GB of RAM sometimes proves insufficient when using heavy apps
Doesn't support fast charging and takes a while to charge
The 5MP selfie camera doesn't capture very clear images

In April 2017, Honor launched a new variant in its budget segment smartphone series which went by the name of Honor Bee 2. The smartphone is the successor of the Honor Bee smartphone launched in mid-2015.

Design & Display
In terms of design, the Honor Bee 2 sports a plastic build and ships in two colour variants, viz. White and Black. On the rear side of the smartphone, Honor has equipped the handset with a camera module and LED flash. Also on the back is Honor branding and a speaker grill. On the front, the phone features a 4.5-inch screen having a resolution of 480 x 854 pixels.

Camera
On the camera front, the smartphone features a 5-megapixel primary camera located on the rear side of the device which is also coupled with an LED flash for low-light photography purposes. Up front, the Honor Bee 2 also sports a front-facing 2-megapixel snapper for capturing selfies and making video calls.

Performance & Memory
The offering from Honor is powered by a quad-core MediaTek MT6735M SoC, coupled with a Mali-T720 MP2 GPU for improved graphics performance. The phone is also packed with 1GB of RAM and 8GB of internal storage which can be expanded up to 32GB through a microSD card.

Connectivity & Battery
Under its hood, the Bee 2 is equipped with a 2100mAh to keep it up and running. In terms of connectivity, the phone supports all the conventional norms such as 4G, VoLTE, WiFi, Bluetooth and a 3.5mm audio jack.

Introduction:: Panasonic Corporation, one of the world’s largest electronics manufacturers, was founded as Matsushita Electric Industrial Co. Ltd. In 1918. The company was renamed to Panasonic Corporation in 2008. Panasonic Eluga Z Smartphone was launched in July 2015.
Display and Design:: Panasonic Eluga Z measures 141.30*70.60*6.85 mm and weighs 120.00 Gms and screen to body approximates 69.1%. It comes with a 5.00-inch multi-touch screen display with a resolution of 720*1280 pixels and pixel density 294 pixels per inch.
Hardware and Features:: In terms of performance, it is powered by 1.4 GHz octa-core MediaTek MT6592M processor, 2 GB RAM, and 16 GB ROM. It runs Android v4.2.2 (KitKat) which is upgradable to v5.0 (Lollipop). Internal storage is 16 GB which is expandable up to 32 GB through microSD card.
Camera Details:: As far as the cameras are concerned, the Panasonic Eluga Z packs a 13 MP primary camera and 5 MP front shooter for selfie.
Battery and Connectivity:: It is powered by a 2050 mAh removable battery by which you can experience talk time up to 15 h and 18 min and standby time 375 hours on 3G network. It is accepted as dual Sims (GSM and GSM) Smartphone. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and 3G. Sensors on the phone include Compass Magnetometer, Proximity sensor, and Accelerometer and Ambient light sensor.

Overview: India-based brand Kult has launched a budget smartphone dubbed as Kult Impulse with good features. Let’s check the technical specifications of this phone in detail:
Display & Design:

On the top, the Kult Impulse features a HD+ display spanning 5.99-inches. The display resolution translates to roughly 268.78 PPI pixel density. A 2.5D curved glass is coated on the top for enhanced viewing experience. The phone appears to be durable with a metal unibody. A fingerprint scanner is located on the back of the phone for secure unlocking.  Sensors like accelerometer, proximity, ambient light and gyroscope are located on the phone. The Kult Impulse ships in two color variants i.e. Black and Blue.
Camera:

On the flip side, the Kult Impulse features a 13MP rear shooter accompanied by dual LED flash for low light photography. There is a 13MP front snapper assisted by LED flash which aids in clicking enhanced selfies in poorly lit conditions. The front camera also doubles up as a way to unlock the phone through facial recognition. The camera software has various modes to enhance the pictures like exposure compensation, white balance setting, digital image stabilization, ISO settings, digital zoom and scene mode. The phone offers Full HD video recording option.
Performance, Storage & OS:

The Kult Impulse is powered by a 1.5GHz quad-core MediaTek MT6739 chipset. It packs 3GB RAM and a PowerVR GE 8100 graphics processor onboard. It ensures smooth multitasking and good gaming performance. Storage-wise, this phone offers 32GB internal memory with an option to expand up to 64GB via microSD card slot for additional needs. The Kult Impulse runs on Android 7.0 Nougat OS out of the box.
Battery & Connectivity:

Underneath the hood, the Kult Impulse houses a huge 4000 mAh battery unit. It is not user removable. It is a dual SIM smartphone and it requires one micro SIM card and nano SIM card for communication. Connectivity options offered on the Kult Impulse include 4G LTE, 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth & VoLTE.

Pros: Premium design with thin-bezels and sandstone finish
Cons: LED notifications supports only white colour

Overview: With over 6 months delay to launch the Jio 4G services in India, Reliance's smartphone brand LYF has been aggressively launching new smartphones. LYF Water 8 is the 19th addition to the brand, which sounds astonishing considering its just been 7 months since the brand launched it's first smartphone in January 2016.

LYF Water 8 is a really good looking device with glass on the back and metal on the sides. The phone is also sleek at just 7mm and handy with a 5 inch display. The phone so far is known to be available in two colors viz., Black and White. Up on the front of the phone sits a 5 inch display that has a resolution of 1280x720 pixels giving it a pixel density of 294PPI and should sharp enough. The display being an AMOLED panel, it should give good viewing experience, however the display lacks Gorilla Glass protection.

Powering the LYF Water 8 on the inside is a Qualcomm Snapdragon 615 Octa Core chipset clocked at 1.5GHz and combined with it is 3GB of RAM. Now, 3GB of RAM should be good enough to handle heavy multitasking and also the processor should hold well in terms of performance but the processor is known for heating issues so you might want to check on that before buying. Coming to the software of the phone, it is based on Android 5.1 Lollipop out of the box, which is slightly a disappointment as we expect devices to now ship with the latest Marshmallow out of the box.

For photography we have a 13MP rear shooter that can record videos up to 1080p @30fps and on the front we have a 5MP sensor for those selfies and video calling needs. Both front and the rear camera sport an LED Flash for those low light shots and selfies. And to store all the media and other date you get 16GB of onboard storage that can be further expanded up to 128GB more via a MicroSD card.

Like all LYF phones this phone is 4G enabled with VoLTE support. LYF Water 8 is a Dual SIM device and accepts Micro+Nano SIMs. Other than the that you get the standard WiFi, Bluetooth. Panasonic, in May 2017 launched a 4G VoLTE-enabled smartphone for its budget-friendly smartphone segment, dubbed as Panasonic P85. The company also launched the Panasonic Eluga Ray alongside the P85. The device sports a sleek build measuring at 9.35mm and weighing 146.7 grams.

Display and Performance
The smartphone sports a 5-inch HD IPS LCD display having a resolution of 1280×720 pixels. Underneath its hood, it is powered by a quad-core MediaTek processor clocked at 1.25GHz. It is coupled with 2GB of RAM and 16GB of inbuilt storage which can be further expanded up to 128GB with a MicroSD card.

Camera
For photography purposes, the Panasonic P85 flaunts an 8-megapixel rear camera with LED flash and autofocus. On the front, it features a 2-megapixel snapper for clicking selfies and making video calls.

Features and Connectivity
The phone is a dual SIM dual standby device which comes with VoLTE support. As far as connectivity is concerned, the phone gets all the standard features such as Bluetooth 4.0, Wi-Fi, GPS, FM Radio, and micro USB port. It runs Android 6.0 Marshmallow and packs in a massive 4000mAh battery.

text.Display and Design: Earth being the premium series of smartphones by the brand LYF, Earth 2 has got some real neat features to justify the price. It is so far the most expensive phone by the brand and in terms of performance it should not disappoint users that use the device for basic purposes and apps but not game a lot, especially graphic intensive games. Even though it might not be the best piece of hardware, the device does support 4G and  as well, something that every LYF device boasts of.
text.Performance and Software: LYF Earth 2 has a handy 5 inch display size that is difficult to find these days, the display has a 1920x1080 pixels resolution that gives the display a pixel density of 441PPI. At this pixel density the display is surely very sharp and crisp. Unfortunately, there is no Gorilla Glass protection. Coming to the design, the device boasts premium build materials like Glass on front and back of the device with Metal sides around the device.
text.Camera and Storage: On the inside we have Qualcomm's Snapdragon 615 chipset running, it is Octa Core chipset clocked at 1.5GHz and paired with it is 3GB of RAM. This combination should provide decent user experience but do not expect the best of gaming experience, however the 3GB of RAM should let multitasking between apps buttery smooth. Talking about the software, LYF Earth 2 disappoints here a bit as it does not ship with the latest Android Marshmallow out of the box but is still based on Android 5.1 Lollipop with no information on future software updates.
text.Battery and Connectivity: On either sides of the device we have got a 13MP shooter which might cheer those selfie lovers and comes with a couple of enhancement features from the software end. Both the cameras can record videos up to 1080p @ 25fps and sport an LED Flash for low light shots, whereas the rear camera also features Laser Autofocus. To store all your high quality pictures and other data you get 32GB of onboard storage which can be further expanded via a MicroSD card up to 64GB.
text.VoLTE support: To power all this there is a 2500mAh battery that which ideally won't last you a day if you are a sort of heavy user. The battery is sealed on the back of the device and unfortunately, the device does not support wireless or fast charging. In terms of connectivity, the phone accepts Dual SIMs of which the second slot is Hybrid which will take a MicroSD card or a Nano SIM. LYF Earth 2 is 4G enabled device with .

Overview: The Panasonic P95 is a budget smartphone aimed at first time buyers launched in May 2018. Let’s check the device overview below:
Display & Design:

The Panasonic P95 features a 5-inch display rocking a resolution of 1280 x 720 pixels. It has a pixel density of 294 PPI. The navigation buttons are located right below the display. For plugging audio accessories there is a 3.5 mm headphone jack. The phone has accelerometer and proximity sensor. The P95 ships in Black color.
Camera:

Coming to the camera, the P95 has a 8MP rear sensor assisted by LED flash. Upfront the phone features a 5MP front snapper for clicking selfies and video calling utilities. The front camera also doubles up in face unlocking since the device lacks a fingerprint sensor.
Performance, Storage & OS:

Under the hood, the Panasonic P95 comes with a Qualcomm Snapdragon 210 processor coupled with 1GB RAM and a Adreno 304 graphics processor onboard. It performs smoothly on normal usage like surfing web and entertainment needs. Storage-wise, the P95 has 16GB internal memory and can be expanded up to 128GB via microSD card. On the software front, the P95 runs on Android 7.0 Nougat OS out of the box.
Battery & Connectivity:
The Panasonic P95 runs on a removable 2300 mAh battery. It functions as dual SIM phone and offers all the standard connectivity options like 4G LTE, 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth and VoLTE.

Smartphone maker Zopo has launched its Color C3 device in India. This launch comes in a month after the launch of the Zopo Color F1. The Color C3 was announced globally at the MWC in Barcelona earlier this year alongside the Zopo F2 and the Zopo F5.

The Color C3 sports a 5 inch HD display with 2.5D glass on the front of the device. The phone is powered by a MediaTek 6737 quad-core processor along with 2GB of RAM. The processor was also found powering the Samsung Grand Prime + recently. The Zopo phone has 16GB of inbuilt storage that is further expandable via a MicroSD card slot. The phone has an 8-megapixel camera at the back and a 5-megapixel camera on the front. Both these cameras feature a Dual LED flash.

The Zopo Color C3 runs on Android Marshmallow with Zopo’s UI customization on top. The phone introduces a feature called double apps that allows users to install one app two times. For eg., this will allow users to have two WhatsApp apps on their smartphone. One other feature that Zopo talked about is called floating video. This enables the user to watch a PiP( Picture in Picture) video while working on a different app.

The phone has a brushed metallic back that gives the phone a premium look. The Zopo Color C3 is a Dual SIM device and has a Micro SIM and a Nano SIM slot. It is a 4G device but only supports Band 3 in India. The phone has a 2100mAh battery that is non-removable. The Zopo Color C3 is priced at Rs 9599 and is available in Rose Gold, Champagne, Marine Blue, Classic Black, and Silver.
In May 2017, Intex launched a new variant in its budget-friendly smartphone portfolio dubbed as the Aqua A4. The device ships in a black colour variant.

Design and Display
On the front side of the phone is a 4-inch 480p display boasting a 60 percent screen-to-body ratio and reproducing a pixel density of about 245 PPI. The phone sports a solid plastic build measuring at a solid 11.4mm in thickness.

Performance and Storage
On the inside, the smartphone is powered by a quad-core Spreadtrum SC9832 processor clocked at 1.3GHz. Together with this, the phone packs in 1GB of RAM and 8GB of internal storage that can be expanded up to 64GB.

Camera
On the camera front, the Intex Aqua 4 features a 5-megapixel primary camera located on the rear-side of the phone which is paired with an LED flash for capturing low-light images. Also, on the front side of the phone, a 2-megapixel secondary camera is provided for selfies.

Battery and Connectivity
The battery of the smartphone is rated at 1,750mAh, which seems less but since the phone is equipped with a 480p display, the company claims it can endure up to 250 hours of standby time. On the connectivity front, the smartphone offers support for WiFi, 4G VoLTE, Bluetooth, USB, GPS and a 3.5mm headphone jack.

Coolpad, a brand known for introducing the fingerprint scanner in budget smartphones and online-only strategy has finally dived into the offline market. The company has launched the Coolpad Note 5 Lite C as its first smartphone to be sold only through offline channels only. Sibling of Note 5 Lite launched earlier this year, the Coolpad Note 5 Lite C is available for purchase through retail stores across the nation.
Display & Hardware:

Talking about the specs, it's just a toned down version of Note 5 Lite which is currently being sold via online platform Amazon. The phone sports a 5-inch HD display with a resolution of 1280 x 720 pixels, hence a pixel density of 294 PPI. Under the hood, the phone is powered by a quad-core Snapdragon 210 paired with 2GB of RAM. The phone gets 16GB of internal storage which can be further expanded up to 64GB via MicroSD card.

For shutterbugs, the Coolpad Note 5 Lite C sports an 8-megapixel primary camera featuring auto-focus and LED flash. Up front, the phone flaunts a 5-megapixel shooter which, however, doesn't get a LED flash. For connectivity, the phone gets Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n, Bluetooth 4.0, GPS/A-GPS, micro-USB as well as 4G LTE connectivity. It is a Dual-SIM smartphone and is compatible with Jio and other 4G networks. Powering all, the Note 5 Lite C packs in a 2,500mAh battery which the company claims to offer 240 hours of standby time.
With the launch of Jio network, the home grown brand LYF has been aggressively launching phones in the sub Rs. 10,000 segment. The Water 7s is the latest addition from the brand in the segment.

LYF Water 7s has an all plastic body, however the device gets a textured back that makes it look & feel good. In general it is a very basic design. Indian smartphone manufacturer Intex added the Aqua Lions T1 in its lineup. The later is comparatively low priced as compared to the former one. Let’s take a look at the phone's overview:
Display & Design:

The phone features a 5.2-inch LCD display with resolution of 854 x 480 pixels & a pixel density of 188.4 PPI. Intex has added ShatterShield screen for advanced protection. The phone has a 3.5mm jack & comes in Black color. It has various sensors like accelerometer, proximity sensor & gyroscope.
Camera:

This phone boasts of a 8MP rear shooter with f/2.2 aperture. It is accompanied by LED flash. The camera software has features like HDR, face beauty, &  panorama. The front camera is equipped with 5MP sensor along with front LED flash for better low light selfies at this price point. The rear camera also allows users to record HD videos (720p).

This device is powered by quad-core 1.3Ghz Spreadtrum processor paired with 1GB of RAM. The phone is suitable for daily tasks. It ships with 8GB internal storage with card slot support up to 64GB. The Aqua Lions T1 runs on latest Android 7.0 Nougat.

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) about Intex Aqua Lions T1:

Ans: Yes, this phone supports VoLTE out of the box and should work well with Jio network.
2.Does both SIM card support 4G?
Ans: Yes, both the sim cards support 4G.
3. How is the camera for selfies?
Ans: There is a 5MP front camera with LED flash that help you click good low light selfies.
4. Is the battery removable?
Ans: Yes, the 2700mAh battery can be removed by the user.
5.What comes in the box?
Ans: In the box you will get the device, charger, earphone & a user manual.
The Aqua Style III is a budget offering by Intex which packs in decent specifications and features at this price range. Let's see what the phone has to offer its users.
Design & Display

The offering from Intex has a decent design and it is available in two colour variants - Black & Champagne Gold. The phone packs in a 5.9-inch FWVGA display which comes with a resolution of 854 x 480 pixels. Although the resolution is quite less, but for a price this low, it shouldn't be a major concern.
Camera:

The phone packs in cameras which justify its price range. On the rear, a 5-megapixel sensor is provided along with an LED flash for capturing pictures and videos. Towards the front, there is a 5-megapixel camera as well, for clicking selfies and video-calling.
Performance & Storage:

Performance-wise, the phone rocks a Spreadtrum processor clocked at 1.3GHz and built on a 32-bit architecture. It also comes with 1GB of RAM which will work with the processor to ensure a smooth performance. To manage graphics, the phone has got a Mali 400 GPU. It runs on Android 7.0 Nougat.
For storage, the Aqua Style III comes with a 16GB internal memory. It can be further expanded up to 64GB via an external microSD card.

To power the device, there is a 2500mAh battery pack provided which will be sufficient for almost a day. It has a removable battery as well.
Connectivity options in the phone include 4G LTE, 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth, VoLTE. For listening to music, a 3.5mm audio jack is provided and for charging, a Micro USB is present.

Overview: The Nokia 3310 is a classic phone by the Finnish brand. After many years, Nokia decided to revisit the past and introduce the highly popular feature phone. Let's see the specifications and features of the Nokia 3310.

The phone looks just like its earlier version but with a modern twist. It is also available in four vibrant colours this time around, two of them bear a matte finish whereas the other two come with a glossy touch. These include Dark Blue (Matte), Gray (Matte), Warm Red (Glossy) and Yellow (Glossy). As expected, the phone is quite durable owing to its tough body.

The 3310 bears a 2.4-inch display with a screen resolution of 320 x 240 pixels. The screen type is LCD and the pixel density is around 166PPI. Thus, the display is good enough for basic usage but not multimedia viewing.

It also has a rear camera measuring 2-megapixels which is coupled with an LED flash to offer lighting while taking pictures. But the internal storage is just 16MB so if you want to capture images or store music files, you will have to expand it via a microSD card. The phone allows expansion up to 32GB externally. There's a 3.5mm headphone jack in the phone through which you can connect your earphone, you will also get one in the box.
The Nokia 3310 is powered by a 1200mAh battery unit which is removable. Considering the specifications, you can easily use the phone for a day or even more on a single charge.
This variant supports Dual SIM and is only 2G enabled. Nokia has also introduced 3G and 4G variants of the phone.

Intro:: Lenovo A1000 model was released in September 2015. This stylish Lenovo smartphone offers exhaustive features including certain useful pre-loaded apps with high speed connecting at a low price point.
Display and Design:: The phone has a 4 inch screen display. It weighs 132 grams and provides a sturdy hold. This is a pocket friendly mobile phone that has a curved back cover providing a good hand grip. It has multi-touch capacitive touchscreen with 800 x 480 pixels resolution. The phone is available in two colors including Pearl White and Onyx Black.
Hardware and Features:: This dual SIM phone uses an Android v5 Lollipop operating system powered by a 1.35 GHz quad-core  Spreadtrum SC7731 processor with Cortex-A7 with Mali-400MP2 GPU. This smartphone has a pre-installed HTML browser and various sensors like accelerometer sensors. The phone has some useful pre-loaded applications like SHAREit, CLONEit and SYNCit used for sharing files, restoring contacts, backing up messages and managing call logs.
Camera and Storage:: The phone has an integrated rear camera of 5MP and 0.3MP front camera. In addition, the LED flash captures vibrant, sharp photos and videos. It also allows video chatting through front camera. The phone is packed with 8GB internal storage which is expandable up to 32GB by inserting a micro SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:: The phone is powered by a removable Li-Po 2000 MAH battery. This 3G enabled Lenovo A1000 has HSPA+ connectivity and provides a high download speed of 21Mbps  allowing one to speedily download videos, music and movies. It can be connected through Wi-Fi, GPS, and Bluetooth.
Competition:: Introducing its A1000 model, Lenovo has given a tough competition to Motorola Moto E (2nd Gen). In the less price compared to Moto E 2nd Gen, Lenovo has provided almost all the features in A1000.

Overview: Reliance Jio network powered smartphone brand from the same parent company, LYF has a set of phones VoLTE phones covering budget segment. LYF Wind 7i is the latest addition to the list.

LYF Wind 7i features a plastic body & has nothing extraordinary to be noticed which is fair for the price. The has good in hand feel & comfortable to use with 5-inch display & around 8.7mm thickness. The 5-inch display comes with a resolution of 1280x720 pixels giving it a pixel density of 294PPI.

Inside the phone you get a Qualcomm's Snapdragon 210 Quad Core processor that is combined with Adreno 304 GPU & 1GB RAM that delivers just about average performance. On the software front, it comes with Android 6.0 Marshmallow out of the box with no details on update schedule.

Rear of the device gets a 8MP camera whereas the front has a 5MP sensor. The rear camera also gets an LED flash & can record videos up to 720p. And in terms of storage there is 8GB of onboard storage that can further be expanded up to 32GB more via a MicroSD card.

LYF Wind 7i comes with a 2250mAh battery that can be user replaced & might not you through the day. Check here for phones with good battery life. In terms of connectivity, it supports all the major network with VoLTE & works perfectly fine with Reliance Jio network.

With the recent launch of F series by LYF, the LYF F8 is the latest addition to it. Like all LYF phones, the F8 also supports Jio network. This phone is priced under Rs. 5,000 and targeted to first time smartphone users to experience Jio network.

LYF F8 gets a plastic body considering the pricing. And thanks to the smaller 4.5-inch display, this phone has got a smaller footprint making it easy to use with one hand. The display has a resolution of 854x480 pixels giving it a pixel density of 217PPI. Unfortunately, there is not Gorilla Glass protection over the display.

Running inside is 1.3GHz Qualcomm Snapdragon 210 Quad Core chipset and along with it is 1GB of RAM. The specs do sound outdated but the motive here is for first time smartphone users to experience Jio network. On the software front, you get LYF's almost near stock Android 6.0 Marshmallow out of the box. It being a budget friendly phone, not may other features are expected.

On the rear of the device is a 8MP sensor that can record videos up to 720p and the rear camera also comes with an LED flash. Whereas on the front you get 5MP camera for selfies and video calling needs. To store all the data you get 8GB of internal storage that can be further expanded up to 128GB via a MicroSD card.
Powering the LYF F8 is a 2000mAh unit that is user removable. In terms of connectivity, you get the standard WiFi & Bluetooth plus the phone does support VoLTE for Jio network.

Introduction:: Ringing Bells Smart 101 is a dual SIM device that was launched in February 2016. It is the cheapest smartphone with given specifications and 4G compatibility in the market.
Display and Design:: Ringing Bells Smart 101 comes with a 5 inch IPS QHD touchscreen LCD display with 960 x 480 pixels screen resolution and 214.66PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 142 x 71.4 x 8 mm and its weight is 125 grams. It is available in dual color, like Black with Gray and White with Gold.
text: This dual SIM device has 1.3GHz quad-core processor, 1GB RAM and Android 5.1 Lollipop Operating system. Proximity sensor, ambient light sensor and gyroscope are in-built. FM radio, 3.5 mm headphone jack and GPS are available. Built-in applications include Google Talk, Google+, Twitter, YouTube, Facebook chat, Gmail, Google Search and WhatsApp.

This dual SIM device is loaded with an 8MP rear camera with LED flash and autofocus and 3.2MP front camera. Users can record videos at 1080p. It has an internal storage of 8GB that can be expanded up to 32GB with the help of 1 micro SD card.

This dual SIM device comes with a 2800mAh Li-ion removable battery that provides the users with a talk time of up to 10 hours on 3G network and a standby time of up to 300 hours. Users will get a talk time of 8 hours when using 4G network. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), EDGE, 3G, GPRS, 2G, Wi-Fi 802 b/g/n, Bluetooth. It accepts 1 micro SIM and 1 regular SIM.

Overview: Introduction:

Swipe Konnect Star is just another budget offering from the Indian smartphone brand Swipe. Considering the price range, it seems like the company is targeting the first time smartphone users with the phone. It also supports 4G VoLTE so that users can make voice calling over 4G networks like Jio. The handset comes in three colour options - Gold, Silver and Grey.
Display & Hardware:

Talking about specs, the Swipe Konnect Star puts on a 4-inch WVGA display with a resolution of 854 x 480 pixels. Under the hood, the phone is powered by 1GHz quad-core processor paired with 1GB of RAM and 16GB of internal memory. The storage is further expandable up to 32GB via a MicroSD card.
Camera:
For shutterbugs, the phone houses a 5-megapixel rear camera accompanied by a LED flash and a 1.3-megapixel selfie camera. It runs Android 6.0 Marshmallow operating system.
Battery & Connectivity:

As far as connectivity is concerned, the Swipe Konnect Star features Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, GPS, microUSB 2.0, 4G LTE, and 3.5mm audio jack. Talking about the power backup, the phone packs in a 1800mAh battery claimed to offer up to 180 hours standby time and up to 10 hours of talk time.

Hardware and Features:\nIt comes with a: It comes with a rear camera of 1.3MP. It has an image resolution of 1280 x 1024 pixels and digital zoom. Video recording feature is available. Panasonic GD25c has an internal storage that can be expanded up to 16GB.

Overview: Introduction:
The Karbonn A41 is yet another budget offering from India's homegrown smartphone brand Karbonn. The phone is available for purchase via online as well as offline channels.
Display & Hardware:

The Karbonn A41 Power puts on a 4-inch WVGA display with a resolution of 800 x 480 pixels. Although, the display resolution is below average, although, considering the price of the device it seems fine. Underneath it, the phone draws its power from a quad-core processor ticking at 1.3GHz. Accompanying the chipset, there's 1GB of RAM and 16GB of inbuilt storage further expandable via a MicroSD card up to 32GB.
Camera:
As far as cameras are concerned, the Karbonn A41 Power sports a 2-megapixel sensor located on the back accompanied by a LED flash. Up front, it houses a VGA camera for selfies and video calling.
Battery & Connectivity:

The Karbonn A41 Power is a Dual SIM phone and also supports to 4G LTE connectivity. Other connectivity options include Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS/A-GPS, micro-USB port, and a 3.5mm audio jack. It runs Android 7.0 Nougat operating system and we're not expecting the Android Oreo at all. Powering all, the device packs in a 2,300mAh Li-ion battery which is touted to offer up to 8 hours of talk time and 300 hours of standby time.

A Chinese phone maker Zopo Mobile added a new device in its Color lineup, the Color F1. The company launched it in India at INR 8,999, available in black, white, and gold colours. The phone comes with multi-accounts support for social networking apps such as WhatsApp, Skype, Facebook, etc. Meaning, the Zopo Color F1 can clone the apps so that users can have multiple accounts running simultaneously. It also comes with built-in Barcode/QR code scanner, App Lock, and floating video integration.

Specs wise, the Zopo Color F1 comes with a 5.5 inches IPS display with 1280×720 pixels resolution and 2.5D curved glass. The phone is powered by a MediaTek MT6580 quad-core and 1GB RAM. The internal storage of 16GB is expandable up to 64GB via microSD. The Zopo Color F1 has a metallic finish and a fingerprint scanner on the back which sits right below the rear camera.

For photography, the phone houses an 8-megapixel primary camera with LED flash as well as a 2-megapixel front-facing camera. It is a dual SIM device and packs in a 2300mAh battery. The Zopo Color F1 also features a floating video integration, which makes it possible for users to play videos while using other apps. The device has a standard set of connectivity options such as 3G, EDGE/GPRS, Bluetooth 4.0, Wi-Fi (802.11b/g/n), and FM Radio.

Indian cell phone company Swipe has announced a new affordable smartphone dubbed Swipe Konnect 4G. The device is currently listed exclusively on Shopclues, so those who are interested in buying this phone can register on the e-commerce portal. However, the actual sale will commence next week, starting December 27th.

Talking about the specifications of Swipe Konnect 4G, it features a 4-inch screen capacitive screen with 1280 x 720 pixels HD resolution. Powering this new addition to Swipe’s budget lineup is a 1.5 GHz quad-core CPU paired with 512MB RAM. It comes with 4GB internal memory that’s expandable up to 32GB via microSD.

In terms of camera of the Swipe Konnect 4G, it houses a 5MP autofocus primary camera with on the back LED flash. Up front, it also carries a 1.3MP secondary camera for video calling and selfies. It then packs in a 2000mAh battery under the hood. This is a Dual-SIM phone that runs Android 6.0 Marshmallow operating system.

As far as the connectivity options are concerned, the Swipe Konnect 4G supports VoLTE. Meaning, this phone is fully compatible with Reliance Jio network. Hence, if you are a Jio subscriber already, you can enjoy free data and voice calling. That aside, it also supports Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, GPS, FM, and microUSB.

Display and Design:: The superbly designed smartphone comes with 5 inch Super AMOLED HD display (1280x720 pixels) along with a pixel density of 294PPI. The device feels supremely light in hand and in the pocket owing to its slim build. The dimensions are 146x71.7x6.9 mm and it weighs 129g. The brilliant display supports 16M colors and is offered in shades of silver, pink, gray and gold.
Hardware and Features:: The device is powered by a  Qualcomm MSM8916 Snapdragon 410 chipset that is clocked at 1.2GHz. Adreno 306 GPU present in the smartphones makes it easy for the users to experience rich graphics. It is pre-installed with the Android Operating System (v 4.4.4 KitKat). Proximity Sensor, Accelerometer and Ambient Light Sensor installed in the device separate it from the others in this league of devices.
Camera and Storage:: The device enables the user to capture the beautiful lifetime memories with its efficient primary camera of 13MP with the features as f/2.0 aperture, LED flash, 1/3.2" sensor size, 1.4µm pixel size, geo-tagging, touch focus, face detection and HDR. It also allows capturing of the selfies with extreme clarity and utmost resolution through its 8MP front camera enhanced with LED flash and autofocus. This device from Lenovo comes with a RAM of 1GB and has got internal storage of 16GB.
Battery and Connectivity:: It comes with a non-removable Li-Po battery with the capacity as 2300mAh. The device supports dual SIM with the first slot for 4G connectivity. Other connectivity options include Wi-Fi, NFC, 3G, GPS/AGPS, Bluetooth v4.0 and USB port.
Competition:: Lenovo S90 Sisley is a budget Smartphone that is power packed and scores high on design. The primary competitors include Moto G4 and Samsung Galaxy J7.

Introduction:: Karbonn Smart A51+ was officially released in India on 28 May 2014. It is an entry-level Smartphone with average specifications and targets to suffice only basic Smartphone requirements. If you look for a low budget smartphone, this could be a good option.
Design and Display:: Karbonn Smart A51+ sports a 3.5 inch LCD Capacitive Touch screen display with a screen resolution of 320*480 pixels which results in a density of 165 pixels per inch. It has a Dimension of 132.0*67.5*9.25 mm, which results in 40.94% screen to body ratio. It is available in Black and White colour.
Hardware and Features:: The Karbonn Smart A51+ is powered by a 1.3 GHz Dual core processor which is coupled with a 256 RAM. It is operated through Android v4.2 (Jelly Bean) which is outdated still acceptable for its affordable price tag.
Camera and Storage:: Karbonn Smart A51+ is loaded with 3.2 MP Primary Camera with a clear image resolution of 2048*1536 pixels. It is also armed with 0.3 MP Front Camera which is decent enough for making video calls. Camera features include LED Flash and Digital Zoom. Its Internal Memory is 512 MB which is further expandable up to 32 GB through MicroSD card.
Battery and Connectivity:: Karbonn Smart A51+ is equipped with 1100 mAh Li-ion battery. It is a Dual SIM Smartphone which supports 2G network only. Other connectivity features include Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Mobile Hotspot and USB etc.

Putting an end to its break, smartphone maker Itel has finally launched a new device targeting the entry-level segment - the Itel it5026. This device seems to be below average but might provide a decent run for the money if you are on an extremely low budget. The device comes assembled with a good enough display, a decently sized 1200mAh battery, and an average camera setup for the price.
Design and Display: The Itel it5026 sports a 2.4 inch display having a resolution of 240 x 320 pixelsand a pixel density of 167ppi.
Cameras: The Itel it5026 features a single 0.3MP camera on the back.
Battery and Performance: The internal storage capacity can be expanded up to 64GB. Fuelling the device is a 1200mAh Li-ion battery.
Software and Connectivity: Speaking of connectivity, the Itel it5026 supports dual sim and Bluetooth. Besides, the smartphone also packs in a 3.5mm headphone jack.
